loans.name: Channphiseth

texts.en: Channphiseth is 33 years old. He is married and has two children. He lives in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. He has been working in a garment factory for more than three years. They earn approximately $12 per day. To improve his house’s condition, Channphiseth is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase materials to decorate the house. This purchase will help provide better living conditions for his family. In the future, he would like to support his children's studies until they get bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to purchase materials to improve his house's condition

loans.name: Ran

texts.en: Ran is 57 years old. She is widowed and resides with her two children in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has been selling cake for more than ten years, earning approximately $3 per day. Her children are employed. One is a construction worker, and the other is a garment worker. They earn about $11 each day. Due to a lack of funds, Ran is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase a piece of land behind her house. This money will help her to expand her land and to get a bigger space to rebuild her house. In the future, she would like to expand her business and to fill dirt into the backyard of her house.

loans.use: to purchase a piece of land behind her house.

loans.name: Samnang

texts.en:
Samnang is 29 years old. She is married and resides with her two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory since 2010, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband is a Chinese interpreter who makes $8 a day. 

In order to improve her family’s finance, Samnang is requesting a loan of $1,500 to purchase groceries to sell in front of the factory. By doing so, she will be able to earn more income to financially support the family. 

In the future, she would like to expand her store and send her children to a good school. Moreover, she wants to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to sell in front of the factory.

loans.name: Kanha

texts.en:
Kanha is 41 years old. She is married and resides with her three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been working as a chef for more than two years, earning approximately $5 per day. Her husband is employed as an officer in the prison. He makes about $4 daily. 

Due to a lack of funds, Kanha is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a house. This purchase will help her provide better living conditions for her family. In the future, she would like to run an additional business and help her children gain a bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase a house.

loans.name: Thavy

texts.en:
Thavy is 34 years old. She is married and lives with her family in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been running a tailoring shop for over five years, earning approximately $9 each day. 

In order to improve her business, Thavy is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase cloth to use for making more clothes to sell. This purchase will help expand her business and earn extra income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her shop and build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase cloth to make more clothes.

loans.name: Mom

texts.en: Mom is 28 years old. She is married and lives with two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been making souvenirs (weaving bananas made of thread) for more than two years, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband runs a business renting sound equipment. He earns about $7 each day. In order to improve her family’s livelihood, Mom is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase construction materials to build a store. This money will help her obtain an appropriate place to run a grocery store. In the future, she would like to expand her business and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to build a grocery store

loans.name: Keang

texts.en:
Keang is 59 years old. She is widowed and resides with her three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a housekeeper. Two of her children are employed in a garment factory. They earn about $6 daily. 

Due to a lack of funds, Keang is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase timber to fix her house. This purchase will help her provide better living conditions for her family. In the future, she would like to run tailoring shop at home and help her youngest child to gain a bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase timber to fix her house.

loans.name: Srey Nhar

texts.en: Srey Nhar is 40 years old. She is married and resides with three children in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. As a housekeeper, Srey Nhar receives support from her husband and children. Her husband is a manual laborer who earns about $4 per day. Two of her children are employed in a garment factory. They earn about $8 daily. In order to improve her family’s finances, Srey Nhar is asking for a loan of $1500 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to run a taxi service. This purchase will help him to generate more income for the family. In the future, she would like to rebuild her house and to help her youngest child earn a bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her husband to run a taxi service.

loans.name: Sothea

texts.en:
Sothea is 33 years old. She is married and resides with her two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than four years, earning approximately $5 per day. Her husband is a rice farmer and also involved in cattle trading. He makes an income of $5 each day. 

In order to improve her farming business, Sothea is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase a water pump, fertilizer and rice seeds for cultivating. This money will help her increase her farming yield and earn more money to financially support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase a water pump, fertilizer and rice seeds for cultivation.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 35 years old. She is married and resides with her three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than two years, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband is a motor taxi driver, who makes an income of $3 each day. 

To be able to access electricity, Mary needs to ask for a loan of $500 to pay for an electricity connection. In the future, she would like to run a grocery store and help her children enter higher education.

loans.use: to pay for an electricity connection.

loans.name: Viktor

texts.en:
Viktor, a married father of three young children, lives in rural central Albania. Like so many other rural residents, he is involved in the agricultural sector.


"Agriculture is all about hard labor and passion as well, that’s all. Yet sometimes, even if we don’t have passion for something, we have no other choice but to just do it.  To add to the benefits of agricultural activities, keeping fit and healthy is very important,” Viktor said, laughing. 


Viktor is requesting your help to buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to order more clothes and jewelry.

loans.name: Salih

texts.en:
Salih lives in a village with his children and wife not far from one of the main cities of central Albania. He is a beneficiary of the Value Chain projects that run in collaboration with World Vision and VisionFund Albania. Salih considers himself lucky to be part of such projects because otherwise he would not qualify for any loans due to the fact that he falls far below the poverty level. Through these projects, the loan interest is paid by World Vision Albania, the major distinction from regular loans.


Salih is requesting a loan of 200,000 Albanian Lek to add some more dairy cows to the herd. Currently he has two cows, yet the income he makes from them is only enough to pay for the family's staple foods.

loans.use: to add more dairy cows to the herd

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 55–year-old rural villager. His village was considered a picturesque place under the communist regime, continuing up until some point after the collapse of that regime. Schools arranged camping for the children, and residents from the nearby city considered the village as their weekend getaway destination. A beautiful small river divided the village almost in half, and very old maple trees offered shade to the visitors. The beauty that existed then, unfortunately, no longer exists.

For the past fifteen years, Ali has been selling fresh agricultural produce that grows on his land. Now, with this loan he wants to buy a dairy cow.

Kindly note that Ali felt a bit uncomfortable having his photo taken in the midst of his growing produce. He was photographed in the back of his newly built walls to his house instead.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Weldow

texts.en: Weldow is a married man. He has 2 children, ages 2 and 6 years. He describes himself as an achiever and determined. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his bicycle. He has been involved in this business for 7 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are regular. He describes his biggest business challenge as harsh climate. He will use the KES 15,000 loan to buy more bicycles for hire. His business goal is to be very prosperous within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy more bicycles for hire

loans.name: Fatmir

texts.en: Fatmir needs your valuable help again to add one more cow to his existing herd. He is extremely thankful to all the lenders who have helped him previously. Here is what he said to the loan officer: "The lenders are doing such an amazing job, and this shouldn't go unnoticed."

loans.use: to buy another dairy cow.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is a married woman. She has 6 children with ranging from 14 to 25. She describes herself as strong, determined and ambitious. She operates a farm where she grows bananas, potatoes, and other crops, which she sells in a food stall. She has been involved in this business for 8 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers come by regularly. She describes her biggest business challenge to be high costs. She will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy maize and beans to sell. She hopes that in the future she will have a good farming business. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM. She repaid her previous loan of 50,000 KES successfully.

loans.use: buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Yoem

texts.en:
Yoem is a 40-year-old, married woman and a mother of three children. She has been dedicated to the agricultural sector for more than 20 years in Kampong Thom province. She works on a few pieces of land, where she grows rice to feed her family and exchange produce for other goods in her village. In the rainy season, she spends 6 to 7 hours at the rice paddy taking care of her farm and makes sure that she can obtain high quality production. 

Yoem aims to proceed with her farming business and to transfer from subsistence farming into commercial. To help her achieve her dream, she is requesting a loan of KHR 4,000,000, which she will use to purchase an extra plot of land to boost her rice production. With the profits she expects to generate from her business as a result of the loan, she plans on improving her farm, and at the same time fulfilling the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase an extra plot of land to boost her rice production.

loans.name: Khim

texts.en:
Khim, age 32, is a married mother and has three children. She currently lives with her family in a rural section of Kampong Thom province. She learned about the duties on a farm when she was a young woman living with her parents, who had done this type of work. She is professional in growing and taking care of the rice crop and preventing loss in her production.  Also, she always looks for ways to get ahead in her business. 

Khim is now requesting her fourth loan for the purchase of timber to improve her old home. This will increase the value of her house and provide good living conditions to her family members. She hopes the loan will be granted to help her family.

loans.use: to buy timber to improve her old home.

loans.name: Evans

texts.en: Evans is a married man. He has 6 children with ages ranging from 2 1/2 years to 16 years. He describes himself as strong and a go getter. He operates a banana stall where he sells bananas. He has been involved in this business for 8 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are regular. He describes his biggest business challenge to be high costs of products and transport. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy stock of bananas for resale. His business goal is to expand within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will be rich. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy stock of bananas for resale

loans.name: Elijah

texts.en:
Elijah is a married man. He has three children with ages ranging from 9 years to 17 years. He describes himself to be strong and determined. He operates a transport business where he transports clients using his bicycle from one place to another. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a good area and his customers are both first timers and regular customers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the harsh climate. 

Elijah will use the Kes 15,000 loan to buy more bicycles to hire out. His business goal is to be very prosperous within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be financially stable. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more bicycles to hire out.

loans.name: Edina Pual

texts.en:
Edina is 45 years of age and married with six children. One of her children is in school. Edina is a fish monger; she sells fish in the market. She has been doing this business for about seven years now.

Edina is a client of Finance Sudan Limited. She has been a client for about three years now, and she learned about Finance South Sudan from some old clients who had borrowed before. Edina is requesting a loan worth 4,000 South Sudanese pounds so that she can expand her business to many clients. She will also be able to provide medication and fees for her family.

loans.use: To buy fish to sell

loans.name: Mirzovatan

texts.ru:
Мирзоватан житель района Хамадони. Ему 34 года. Он скотовод, занимается разведением крупнорогатого скота для продажи. Мирзоватан женат и отец двух сыновей. Его сыновьям 3 и 1 год. Вместе с ними также живут его родители, которые являются пенсионерами. Жена Мирзоватана домохозяйка. Она присматривает за маленькими детьми и ведет домашнее хозяйство. 
Мирзоватан обеспечивает свою семью за счет прибыли с животноводства. Сейчас для продолжения деятельности ему необходимо увеличить поголовье скота. Он просит кредит для приобретения одного бычка.
texts.en:
Mirzovatan is 34 and a resident of the Hamadoni region. He is a cattle herder and breeds and sells big-horned cattle. Mirzovatan is married and a father to two sons aged one and three. His parents, who are retired, also live with them. Mirzovatan's wife is a homemaker. She looks after her small children and takes care of the house.

Mirzovatan takes care of his family with the money he earns from animal husbandry. Now, to keep his business going, he needs to increase the size of his herd. He is requesting a loan to purchase a steer.

loans.use: to purchase a steer

loans.name: James Brown

texts.en:
James is a 54 year-old father of seven children, two of which are in school. He has been a Finance Sudan client for about 3 years now.
 
James is a businessman who runs a general store that sells mixed items like sodas, clothes, sugar and many other items. He has been in this business for over 10 years now. Apart from the shop, he is also a tailor and makes school uniforms and designs clothes.

James is borrowing a loan of 3,000 South Sudanese Pounds to enable him to expand his business, so that he can serve many more clients.

loans.use: to buy items like sugar, sodas, clothes and other merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy items like rice, cooking oil, tea leaves, beans, and other household goods for resale

loans.name: Margaret Estela

texts.en:
Margaret is a client of Finance Sudan Limited.  She has been a client for about two years. She is 38 years of age, married and with four children, two of which go to school. She is a business woman who sells fish in the market. 

Margaret is borrowing a loan worth 1,500 South Sudanese Pounds to help her expand her business and serve more customers. The loan will also help her cater for her family needs.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Yodgor

texts.ru: Ёдгор трудолюбивый и целеустремленный человек. Ему 47 лет. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Он очень заботливый отец. Ёдгор старается обеспечить своих детей со всеми не обходимыми средствами и для этого он упорно работает в течение многих лет в государственной организации. Ёдгор недавно решил купить новый дом, так как его текущий дом, старый и просто невозможно жить. Ёдгор с такой целью накопил деньги, но ему не хватает денег. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 2500 долларов США. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие. Этот займ поможет ему улучшить условию проживания и таким образом принесет радость и покой в его семье.
texts.en: Yodgor is a hardworking and ambitious man. He is 47 and married and has three children for whom he is a very caring father. Yodgor tries to provide his children with all they need and to this end he has been working hard for many years in a government organization. Not long ago he decided to buy a new house, as the current one is old and impossible to live in any longer. With this goal in mind he has been saving money, but he doesn't have enough, and therefore he is requesting a loan of US$2,500. He awaits your kindness and hopes for your charity. This loan will help him improve his living conditions and make his family happy and free of stress.

loans.use: To buy a new home for his family

loans.name: Ever Queen

texts.en:
Ever is a Finance Sudan Limited client. She heard about Finance Sudan through staff marketing. 

She is 40 years old, married and has four children.
 
Ever is a businesswoman who runs a fish selling market. She sells different types of fish to her customers.

She is requesting a loan of 1,500 South Sudanese Pounds to enable her to buy more fish for resale. She says that this loan will enable her to get fish directly, rather than through a middle man, which will reduce her cost and increase her volumes of sales. Ever also says that the loan will enable her to pay for school fees and medical care for her family.

loans.use: to buy fish for resale

loans.name: Sreypov

texts.en: Sreypov is 21 years old. She is single and lives with her father in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been teaching foreign language for more than two years, earning approximately $3 per day. Her father sells coffins; he earns about $10 daily. In order to improve her family’s finances, Sreypov asks for a loan of $1000 to purchase shoes to sell at home. This money will help her acquire the ability to run a new business and earn more income for the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and rebuild her house to make it much stronger.

loans.use: to purchase shoes to sell at home

loans.name: Pholly

texts.en: Pholly is 27 years old. She is married and resides with two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than ten years, earning approximately $5 daily. Her husband is a motor taxi driver who makes an income of $4 each day. Due to lack of funds, Pholly is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase construction materials for her house. This money will help her have a good house for her family. In the future, she would like to run grocery store at home and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to build her house

loans.name: Lout

texts.en:
Lout is 54 years old. She is married and resides with four children in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in cultivating rice and fattening up animals for more than ten years, earning approximately $2 daily. Her children are employed. They are garment workers and a construction worker. They earn about $20 each day.

In order to improve her family’s finances, Lout is requesting a loan of $1,500 to purchase a motorbike and a trailer to run a delivery service. This purchase will help her to generate more income for the family. In the future, she would like to rebuild her house.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike and a trailer to run a delivery service

loans.name: By

texts.en:
By, age 55, is married and a mother of four children. She lives with her family in Kampong Thom province. To feed her children and send them to school, she is involved in retail business and piglet fattening business. Having experience in raising piglets for more than 10 years, she mentioned that pigs are not animals which are difficult to raise because they can eat rotten fruits, bran and veggies. The fact is that pigs and the pigpen need to be sanitized regularly to protect them from the bacteria and diseases caused by sewage. Her children are giving her a helping help in managing their retail store while By is busy with taking care of the piglets.

At this time, By needs working capital to sustain her shop, but she has inadequate capital. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of KHR 4,000,000 to buy grocery items for resale. With the increase of her inventory, she hopes to have more customers and generate more income.

loans.use: to buy grocery items for resale.

loans.name: Wilmer Ismael

texts.es: El cliente es de la ciudad de Machala.  Trabaja como operador en Puerto Bolívar y le facilitaron una línea para que pueda vender helados de la línea Topsy.  En la noche trabaja en los embarques del puerto y por el día se dedica a la venta de helados.  Es casado y su esposa lo ayuda en la venta por el día.  Tiene 2 hijos, uno estudia y el otro no.  Desea invertir el dinero del préstamo en la compra de helados para su venta.
texts.en:
This borrower is from the city of Machala.  He works as an operator in Puerto Bolívar and was also given a franchise for selling Topsy brand ice cream.  At night he works at the loading docks of the port and sells ice cream during the day.  The borrower is married and his wife helps with making sales during the day.  They have two children, one is in school and the other is not.  

The borrower would like to invest the money from this loan in the purchase of ice cream that he can sell.

loans.use: to buy ice cream to sell.

loans.name: Bunroeun

texts.en:
Bunroeun is 53 years old. She is married and lives with five children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. 

Bunroeun's husband is a farmer and motor taxi driver and earns about $4 each day. Three of their children are employed and earn about $15 every day.

Bunroeun has been selling sizzling cake for more than five years, earning approximately $3 daily. In order to improve her family’s livelihood, Bunroeun is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase farmland for rice cultivation. This purchase will help her expand her family's farming business. 

In the future, she would like to run an animal husbandry business and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees. Bunroeun is saving money to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase farmland for rice cultivation

loans.name: Teopista

texts.en:
Teopista is a single mother of four children and all her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (3 brothers). She resides in a rented house and the family has no access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

She has a business selling used clothes and has been in this business for 4 months. She has applied for a loan of 200,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes to sell. She works at the market seven days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She aspires to become a wholesaler and also to build her own house.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes for resale.

loans.name: Phorn

texts.en: Phorn is 33 years old. She is single and lives in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has been selling rice at home for more than three years, earning approximately $10 per day. In order to improve her business, Phorn is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase more rice to sell. This money will help her increase her stock. In the future, she would like to build a store and build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase more rice to sell

loans.name: Samon

texts.en: Samon is 27 years old. She is widowed and lives with her mother in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has one child. She has been selling noodles for more than five years, earning approximately $10 per day. Her mother helps her run the business. In order to improve her family’s livelihood, Samon is requesting a loan of $1500 to purchase drinks to add in her store. In addition, a part of this money will be used to buy palm leaf thatches to fix the roof of her store. This money will help her expand her business and earn more income for the family. In the future, she would like to build a new house and send her child to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase drinks to add in her store

loans.name: Iem

texts.en:
Iem is a 32-year-old married woman living in with three other family members in Kandal province. She is a mother of two children, whom she loves very much. They are the reason she is encouraged to work hard and make a great effort to get ahead in her sewing career in order to provide them with a good quality of life. Likewise, her husband, who works in construction industry, does the same things for the sake of the children.
 
Iem is very thankful for the loan support she receives from Kiva lenders through HKL branch office. This will enable her to concrete the ground level of her house, which will improve her living conditions. She will continue her efforts to make her dream of having a tailoring shop in her neighborhood.

loans.use: to concrete the ground level of her house.

loans.name: Phally

texts.en: Phally is 27 years old. She is married and lives in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has a two-year-old child. She has been working in a garment factory for more than two years, earning approximately $4 per day. Her husband is a construction worker who earns about $10 each day to help cover her family’s expenses. Due to lack of funds, Phally requests a loan of $1000 to purchase timber to build her house. This money will help provide convenient place for her family’s living. In the future, she would like to run an additional business and send her child to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase timber to build her house

loans.name: Wilson Roberto

texts.es: El cliente es de la ciudad de Machala.  Su actividad la aprendió de su familia, en donde ha sido una tradición desde hace mucho tiempo atrás.  Desde pequeño ha trabajado en la pesca artesanal y con ello ha podido mantener a su familia hasta ahora.  Trabaja con un hijo y lo hacen por la mañana, donde se quedan 2 días para poder realizar la pesca.  Está en estado de unión libre y su cónyuge se encarga de las labores del hogar.  Tiene 2 hijos mayores, quienes ya tienen sus compromisos.  Ahora quisiera invertir el dinero del crédito en la compra de materiales para su trabajo de pesca, como mallas y fibra.
texts.en:
This borrower is from the city of Machala.  He learned his trade from his family since it is a longtime tradition.  From a young age, the borrower has worked as a small-time fisherman and now he is able to support his family.  He works with his son and they leave in the mornings and make two-day trips in order to catch fish.  The borrower is in a common-law relationship and his partner is in charge of the household duties.  They have two grown children who are already in relationships.  

For now the borrower wants to invest the money from his loan in the purchase of materials for his work as a fisherman, such as nets and fishing line.

loans.use: to buy nets and fishing line.

loans.name: Yanery Altagracia

texts.es:
Yanery es una joven estudiante de Odontología, ella está solicitando un préstamo para poder pagar sus estudios, esta es su historia:Mi nombre es Yanery, tengo 22 años de edad, vivo en el municipio de Jarabacoa, Republica Dominicana, vengo de una familia de muy bajos recursos, soy la numero dos de nueve hermanos, de los cuales soy la primera en ir a la universidad. Desde niña soñaba con ser una doctora, soñaba y me imaginaba con mi bata blanca y larga pero mientras crecía y miraba a mi alrededor ese sueño se hacía cada día mas difícil de lograr, ya que mi madre no tenía los recursos para hacer ese sueño realidad, mi madre es una mujer luchadora, fue una madre soltera, nunca conocí a mi padre pues él nos abandonó cuando nací.  Mi madre tuvo que enfrentarse a la vida sola, no tenía todo lo necesario pero le doy gracias a Dios por mi madre, ella me enseñó a ser una persona que lucha por lo que quiere y no se rinde tan fácil. Gracias a esos valores terminé mis estudios secundario, no fue tan fácil para mi poder ir a la escuela porque tenía que caminar grandes distancias, muchas veces con el sol tan fuerte encima de mí y otras veces con la lluvia, a pesar de todo esto tenia mis metas bien claras y lucharía hasta mas no poder para alcanzar ese sueño que desde niña esta en mi corazón. 
Para poder terminar la secundaria me vi obligada a mudarme de la casa de mi madre para vivir con una amiga de la familia, desde su casa era más fácil para mi ir a la escuela. Al terminar el bachillerato estaba feliz y a la vez triste, feliz porque había subido un escalón más y estaba más cerca de mi sueño de ir a la universidad y triste porque todos mis compañeros fueron a la fiesta de graduación y tuvieron sus fotos en cambio yo no, mi madre no pudo pagarme un vestido ni teníamos para tomarme mi foto de graduación. 
Tuve que trabajar a muy temprana edad, desde muy joven limpiaba casas y cuidaba niños, realizando estas tareas pude inscribirme en la universidad y estoy en mi segundo año cursando en la carrera de odontología, me encanta el área de medicina y mi deseo es terminar y poder ayudar a muchas personas.
Hasta ahora he cubierto estos dos años de estudios pero ya siento que no puedo más, es tan difícil, ahora me he quedado sin trabajo y tengo un cuatrimestre que no puedo estudiar porque no tengo los recursos necesarios para seguir, por esta razón es que solicito la ayuda. 
Para mí sería una gran bendición si deciden ayudarme, ya que sin este préstamo mi sueño no se haría realidad porque no tengo los recursos para la universidad y todo lo que lleva la carrera. Si no recibiera este préstamo mi vida cambiaría por completo, si lo recibo mi deseo es usar estos dones, talentos, habilidades y conocimientos para ayudar a otras personas. Con mi carrera de odontología poder poner una sonrisa en rostros de personas que creen no hay esperanza. 
Espero que mi historia haya movido su corazón y decidan bendecirme con su ayuda.
texts.en:
Yanery is a young student of Odontology who is requesting a loan to cover her tuition. This is her story: My name is Yanery and I am 22 years old. I live in the municipality of Jarabacoa, Dominican Republic, and come from a very low-income family. I am the second of nine siblings and the first one to attend university. I have always dreamed about becoming a doctor and imagined myself wearing a white and long robe. However, as I was growing up and looked around me, this dream seemed harder to achieve. My mother is a very hardworking woman, but did not have the resources to make it possible. She was a single mother and I never met my father, who left us when I was born. My mom had to get ahead by herself and I am grateful to God for her. She taught me to fight for what I want and to never give up. Thanks to these values, I was able to finish my secondary studies. It was not easy for me to go to school as I had to walk long distances with hot weather or sometimes rain. However, I knew what my goal was and I would fight to make my dream come true. I moved from my mother's house and lived with a friend of the family, which made it easier to attend classes. When I finished high-school I was both happy and sad. I was happy because I had moved one step forward and was closer to my dream of going to university, but I was sad because I was not able to be at the graduation party with the rest of my classmates or have photos taken, as my mother could not buy me a dress or pay for my graduation photo. 

I started working when I was very young, cleaning houses and taking care of kids. This is how I could attend university. I am currently studying my second year of Odontology, an area of Medicine that I really like, and my dream is to finish and to help many people. I have been able to cover tuition for these two years, but it is too hard now. I do not have a job right now, but still need to pay tuition for one semester, which is why I am requesting the loan. It would be a blessing to count on your help and to use my talent, knowledge and abilities to help people. I could put a smile on the faces of those that think there is no hope. 

I hope my story has moved you and that you will decide to bless me with your help.

loans.use: to cover the tuition of her Odontology studies, as well as books and transportation.

loans.name: Pheng

texts.en:
Pheng is a 35-year-old married woman and has three children. She was born in a family farm and learned farming from her parents. 

Pheng and her spouse inherited a few pieces of land from both parents after they got married. However, their land doesn't produce enough to feed their children, so her husband and her oldest child work as paid laborers in a rubber tree plantation to supplement their income. 

Their challenge is that they don’t have their own motorcycle for commuting to work, and motor taxis are expensive. Therefore, Pheng is looking for ways to facilitate their transportation needs by getting a loan through HKL, which she will use to buy a motorcycle. This will help them reduce unnecessary expenses and improve her family's living standards.

Pheng thanks Kiva lenders for the constant loan support.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Saslesy

texts.en: Saslesy is 34 years old and married with one child. He lives with his wife and child in a suburban area of Phnom Penh. His wife is a homemaker, so he is the only breadwinner in his family. He makes a living by creating knives from metal and selling them in markets of his region. He has been doing this for five years and earns a profit of $11.00 per day. However, his business is not so stable as their living costs are increasing from day to day. Apart from his current business, he is always seeking ways of making additional income to secure the welfare of his family members. A loan of 1,000 US dollars will make his dream of having retail store at home a reality.  It will be managed by his wife. This way, he and his wife can help each other earning income to save for their child when he grows up. He will use the loan to start up a retail business and buy merchandise to sell in his new store. Thanks for constant support from kind lenders.

loans.use: to start up a retail business and buy merchandise to sell in his new store.

loans.name: Sam Oeun

texts.en:
Sam Oeun is 34 years old. She is married and resides with her four children in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia.

She has been working in a garment factory for more than two years, earning approximately $4 per day. Her husband is a construction worker who earns about $5 daily. One of her children is also employed in a garment factory and earns about $4 each day. 

Due to lack of funds, Sam Oeun is requesting a loan of $400 to purchase timber to build her house. This money will help her provide better living conditions for the family. She hopes she can support her children's studies until they finish their bachelor degrees.

loans.use: to purchase timber to build her house

loans.name: Keo

texts.en:
Keo is a resident of Kandal province. She is 47-years-old and married with four dependent children. To make a living, Keo and her husband operate a traveling sale business, making and selling ice-cream in local areas. They have been in business for three years and earn a proper income from these activities. 

Due to inadequate working capital to maintain her business, she has requested a loan amounting to 1,500 US dollars in order to buy ingredients to make ice cream to sell. This loan will be favorable to allow her to boost income. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future business as well as emergencies of their family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make ice cream to sell.

loans.name: Klodiana

texts.en:
Klodiana is a 33-year-old married mother of two school-aged children, aged 14 and eight-years-old, who lives in rural south eastern Albania. 

Five years back Klodiana started selling raw milk to the nearby dairy farm and since then she has continued the activity by adding more cows in an attempt to increase the raw produce. However, at the moment, one of her cows is not producing as much milk as before due to its age, so she wants to replace it. This loan will help Klodiana achieve that.

Klodiana wants to keep increasing her activity to make it to a farm soon.  Her husband helps her out with all the activity’s requirements.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow.

loans.name: Kun

texts.en:
Kun, 32, is married and has three children. He lives with his family in the Ponhea Lueu district of Kandal province. He works very hard in agriculture, farming rice on a small plot of land. The land doesn’t produce enough to feed his family, so he also works in construction sites in order to have additional income. Thanks to his wife who helps him earn income with her tailoring business.

To help him maintain his farming business, Kun is requesting a loan in order to buy farming supplies such as fertilizers and pesticides in order to keep his crop in good condition and to pay for the labor. His business plan is to expand his land and make it more productive, so that he can give his family more financial stability and improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies such as fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Mrike

texts.en:
Mrike wants to build a stable with the loan she is requesting this time and this will be her second loan.  She has been in the livestock type of activity for over twenty years and, according to her, it has proved to be successful.

Mrike’s husband was born mute at birth and together they have four children. “My husband is mute, but he is a very hard working man; sometimes I feel he tries to compensate for other things that he can’t be of any help by working really hard and non-stopping. We work together in the livestock activity; I wouldn’t be able to do it on my own,” said Mrike to the loan officer. 

Mrike has four children who still go to school.

loans.use: to build a stable for her animals.

loans.name: Chhin

texts.en:
Chhin is 31-years-old. She is married and has two school-aged children. She lives in a peaceful village in the Rolea B’ier district, Kampong Chhnang province.  Chhin has her own business, selling used clothes in a local market and she earns approximately $5.00 per day. She has managed this business for almost three years and has learned to develop it progressively. She is an honest and friendly woman and that’s why she has many customers supporting her business with their purchases.

Chhin​ doesn't have her own motorcycle to fulfill their transportation needs and support her vending business, so she is now asking for a loan in the sum of 1,000 US dollars in order to purchase a motorcycle. She successfully paid off her previous loan with a good credit history. She awaits for another opportunity of this loan to improve her living status as well as business.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to provide safe dinking water to over 500 people on Borneo Island, Indonesia

loans.name: Beni

texts.en:
Beni sells firewood and dairy products and he has been doing this for almost five years now, after his return from Greece. He had lived there as an immigrant for a long time until the economy went downwards in that country, unfortunately. 

Beni is applying for a second loan. This time it's to use for his agricultural needs, such as buying pesticides, buying fodder for his animals for the winter, preparing the soil, etc. He does all the work in collaboration with his father, who according to Beni is very strong physically. 

Beni is a 30-year-old single man who lives in a rural area. His plans are to get married soon and have a family of his own

loans.use: To buy pesticides, fodder for the animals for the winter, etc.

loans.name: Oun

texts.en:
This is Oun, a humble farmer living in Kampong Cham province. She is a 45-year-old married woman and a loving mother of four adult children. She cultivates rice on a few pieces of land to generate a livelihood. Having been in this business for 13 years, she has developed her plantations gradually and tried to make them more feasible and profitable.

Oun and her family live in an old house which is in bad condition; it needs a lot of repairs. Therefore, she has requested a loan which allows her to make some home improvements. This loan will help her to buy construction materials and pay for the labor. From this loan, she will be able to cover the construction costs and provide a suitable home to her family members as soon as possible. This will give them better living conditions.

loans.use: to make some home improvements.

loans.name: Frane

texts.en:
Frane wants to expand her existing animals’ stable with this loan. Agriculture has been the only type of activity for her for the past 23 years. She has been able to generate an okay income for her family by selling the fresh produce and raw milk to the locals. 

“Being the only one to generate an income for the family adds lots of stress on someone, but thank God that I have had my husband who has been supporting me; he has been taking the milk to the nearby market, taking the cows out sometimes, etc., but he is not the early riser like me to wake up at 4am each and every morning.  Agriculture/livestock is an activity that requires both husband and wife otherwise…,” Frane said smiling.

“We lived in the most rural north before we came to this current location. As you can see, it is all new houses built here and majority of us come from the same region,” Frane continued saying.

loans.use: to expand the existing stable

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is a married woman. She has 6 children with ages ranging from 2 years to 17 years. She describes herself to be ambitious and innovative. 

Monica sells livestock, i.e. goats and sheep, to earn a living. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located in an area with enough customers and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to add stock of goats and sheep for resale. She hopes that in the future, she will increase her income. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: add stock of goats and sheep for resale

loans.name: Zarina

texts.en:
Zarina is a 46-year-old sick lady. All of her devotions are for her elder son, who is earning a very low income. Her son provides services for sheltering for under-construction houses. Most of the work depends on the contract, and most of the time he unable to get any contract for sheltering services. 

Recently, Zarina's son has gotten a huge contract, but he does not have enough sheltering material to provide proper services. Zarina requested a loan so that her son would be able to buy more sheltering material to provide his best services. She hopes for the marriage of her son and making some savings from time to time. With the profit amount she will arrange the marriage ceremony of his elder son. 

Zarina is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan. She is hopeful that the Kiva lenders take pity on her and support her in the form of this loan.

loans.use: To buy sheltering materials

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a 40-year-old married man. He has 2 children, ages 6 months and 4 years. He describes himself to be active and faithful. He operates a dairy farm where he keeps dairy cows for milk production. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His primary customers are locals and dairy farmers cooperative society. He describes his biggest business challenge to be poor transport during the rain season.

He will use the 100,000 KES loan to buy a motorbike for transporting his milk. His business goal is to be a commercial dairy farmer within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will educate and feed his family. A previous loan of 20,000 KES was repaid successfully. He will use the profits from the milk sales to repay back the loan.

loans.use: buy a motorbike for transporting his milk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is a married man. He has 2 children with ages 2 years and 16 years. He describes himself to be courageous, determined, patient, and polite. He is a mechanic and he repairs motor vehicles. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of enough capital.

He will use the KES 80,000 loan to purchase a machine to assist in repairing motor vehicles. His business goal is to start a garage within 5 years. He hopes that in the future he will educate his children to college level. This is his third loan with SMEP DTM. A previous loan of KES 50,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: purchase a machine to assist in repairing motor vehicles

loans.name: Narayani Mission Shakti Self Help Group

texts.en:
Khulana is a 46-year-old lady living with her husband and her two children. She runs a snacks stall in her village; she has a few years of experience in this activity. She sells snack items like samosas (fried dough stuffed with potato curry), 'Idli' (a popular recipe of south Indian origin made by steaming a batter consisting of fermented black lentils and rice), 'Wada' (lentil doughnuts) etc. in her shop.

She wants to expand her business by selling more of the items she sells now and to make a display case for her shop for the products she cooks. She says that doing so will attract more customers to her shop.

Khulana,  along with her group, has requested a loan amount of 240,000 INR. She wants to utilize her portion of the loan for purchasing raw materials like potatoes, spices, edible oil, lentils, rice, etc. and for making a display case for her shop. She has a dream of having her children study in a good school and saving some money for their future.

Narayani Mission Shakti Self Help Group has 12 members of which all are women, and are all neighbours.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing potatoes, spices, edible oil, lentils, rice, etc. and for making a  display case for her shop.

loans.name: Pius

texts.en:
Pius is a married man. He has 1 child. He describes himself to be strong and a go-getter. 

He operates a butchery where he sells meat. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in a good area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the high cost of meat. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more meat for resale. His business goal is to expand within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will have a big butchery in town. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy more meat for resale

loans.name: And Siggil Hann 2 Group

texts.fr: L’Association And Siggil Hann regroupe plusieurs femmes ressortissant de l’une des banlieues  Dakaroises. Au départ elles se fréquentaient   a travers des  tontines  hebdomadaires  qui leur permettaient de s’autofinancer pour soutenir leurs activités génératrices de revenus .Actuellement l’association vient de signer un partenariat avec l’UIMCEC dans le cadre du renforcement du pouvoir économique des femmes  pour les aider  a mieux gérer leurs activités et lutter contre la pauvreté. De ce fait And Siggil Hann 2  est un groupe de crédit de 10 femmes  qui habite le même  quartier. Elles sont représentées par madame Oumy Diop, femme mariée qui évolue depuis 10 ans dans le secteur du commerce et pratique la vente de poissons. Grace aux revenus que lui procure son activité elle parvient a participer a la dépense quotidienne de son foyer. Elle capitalise une expérience de 20 ans dans ce domaine. Elle démarre chaque jour son travail à 6 heures du matin pour rentrer chez elle  a 13 heures. Elle est membre de l’un des guichets de l’UIMCEC ou elle sollicite un crédit prévu pour l’achat de poissons destinés  à la vente. Son ambition est d’accroitre ses bénéfices afin d’épargner plus d’argent et aussi participer a l’amélioration des conditions alimentaires de sa famille. Son projet futur consiste a développer davantage son commerce de poisson.
texts.en:
The association called "And Siggil Hann" unites several women who come from one of the suburbs of Dakar. In the beginning they came together in weekly savings groups which allowed them to self-finance in order to maintain their income-generating activities. 

Presently, the association has signed a partnership agreement with UIMCEC intended to reinforce the economic power of women to help them to better manage their businesses and combat poverty. So "And Siggil Hann 2"  is a borrowing group of 10 women who live in the same district. They are represented by Madame Oumy Diop, a married woman who has been in the commercial sector for 10 years and who sells fish. Thanks to the income from her business, she is able to participate in supporting her household. 

Madame Oumy Diop is banking on experience gathered over 20 years in this field. She begins work every day at 6 am, going home at 1 pm. She is a member of one of the branch offices of UIMCEC where she is requesting a loan to buy more fish for resale. Her ambition is to grow her profit so as to save more money and also to participate in improving the nutrition of her family. Her future plan is to expand her fish sales business further.

loans.use: to buy fish for resale

loans.name: Ana Andrea

texts.es: Doña Ana Andrea es originaria de san Martin jilotepeque, y tiene más de 37 años de dedicarse a la venta de comida. Tortillería y crianza de marranos. Doña Ana  Andrea tiene más de cinco años de recibir la ayuda de fape y kiva, está muy agradecida porque gracias a ello ha logrado ayudar a su esposo a sacar adelante a sus hijos, les logro dar  estudio y darles a sus hijos una base para poder sobresalir por ellos mismos. doña Andrea solicita el crédito para la compra de maíz y leña, compra de arroz, frijol. y afrecho, granillo y marranos para engorde y crecimiento.
texts.en: Doña Ana Andrea is originally from San Martin Jilotepeque and has for over 37 years worked running a tortilla shop and raising pigs. She has borrowed from FAPE and Kiva for over five years. Doña Ana Andrea and her husband are very grateful for this help as it's allowed them to provide for their children, pay for their education, and help the children get ahead. Doña Ana Andrea is applying for a loan to purchase corn and wood, rice, and beans as well as bran, grains, and pigs to for fattening.

loans.use: to purchase corn and wood, rice, and beans as well as bran, grains, and pigs to for fattening.

loans.name: Ann Maa Tarini Self Help Group

texts.en:
Ann Maa Tarini Self Help Group is a group consisting of nine members of whom all are women. These entrepreneurs are very humble, hardworking and responsible people with good manners and lots of enthusiasm to improve their lives. A few years back, they all were facing the same kind of situation of poverty, so they planned to start a grocery shop where they could provide the basic household consumables to their customers. 

One of them is Mrs. Sukanti who was selected as their president. Sukanti is a 40-year-old lady living with her husband. The lady sitting in the middle wearing a green saree is Sukanti. Her husband works as a laborer in a factory situated near her village. She runs a grocery shop to help her husband financially. She sells rice, grains, lentils, edible oil, spices, biscuits, soap, detergent, hair oil, etc. in her shop. She has developed a very good relationship with her customers in the village. 

Sukanti likes the fact that she can cater for the needs of the people in her village. She has a plan to make her shop bigger and keep multiple things in her shop to satisfy her customers. She also wants to purchase the items for her shop in bulk directly from the wholesalers, for which reason she has requested a loan to utilize in purchasing items like toothbrushes, toothpaste, soft drinks, wheat flour, grains and other household consumables. Sukanti, along with her group members, has requested a loan amount of 180,000 INR.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing items like toothbrushes, toothpaste, soft drinks, wheat flour, grains and other household consumables for her shop

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick is a 32-year-old man. He has two children aged 6 years and 2 years. He describes himself to be God-fearing. He operates a shoe stall where he sells shoes. He has been involved in this business for seven years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are regular customers. 

Fredrick describes his biggest business challenge to be harsh climate and high costs. He will use the KES 40,000 loan to add stock of shoes for resale. He hopes that in the future, he will be wealthy.

loans.use: add stock of shoes for resale

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en:
Peninah is a 51-year-old single woman. She describes herself as a person who never loses opportunities. She has two children. She operates a farm where she keeps dairy cows and also grows crops. She also owns a wholesale shop. 

Peninah will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy metal sheets to roof her rental houses. She hopes that in the future, she will have additional income. This is her fifth loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loans were repaid successfully

loans.use: to buy metal roofing sheets

loans.name: Valbona

texts.en:
For the past five years, Valbona has been practicing her agricultural skills; she has been planting a variety of veggies and grains and also adding some more orchards. Valbona has been selling her produce at the local market or to random individual clients or fruit market stores. She says that the income she has earned from the activity has been good so far.

Valbona is married and has two children who are attending school still; they are 22 and 18 years of age. They reside in a rural village in northern Albania.

This loan of 250,000 Albanian Lek will be her second one and she will use it to build an irrigation system on her agricultural land.

loans.use: to build an irrigation system on her agricultural land

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 37-year-old married woman. She has 4 children with ages ranging from 3 years to 13 years. She describes herself to be determined. 

She operates a beauty salon where she offers hair dressing services, i.e. hair treatment, plaiting, etc. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in an area good for business and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough money to boost business. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy hair braids and other cosmetics. Her business goal is to expand to hair dressing college within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy hair braids and other cosmetics

loans.name: Gloria Elizeth

texts.es:
Gloria, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo, ya que requiere de más capital de trabajo para continuar en su actividad que realiza de sastrería; esta inversión le ayudara a comprar materia prima necesaria tales como: tela, hilos, botones, una maquina, entre otros.
Comenta la Sra. Gloria que el crédito anterior le ayudo a incrementar sus inventarios y obtuvo mayores ingresos. Las condiciones económicas han mejorado, mientras que  las circunstancias familiares se han mantenido.
texts.en: Gloria feels the need to opt for a new loan because she needs more working capital to continue with her tailoring work. This investment will help her buy necessary supplies such as fabric, thread, buttons, a sewing machine, and more. Gloria says that her prior loan helped her increase her inventory and obtain a better income. Her financial condition has improved, and her family circumstances have remained the same.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, buttons, a sewing machine, and more

loans.name: Candida Gloria

texts.es:
Candida  de 62 años de edad,  es casada.

Ella administra su propia tienda en su casa, debido a que identifico que en su lugar de residencia existía la necesidad de contar con una tienda de productos básicos. Antes ella destazaba cerdos y comercializaba la carne. Pero hoy en día solo se dedica a atender la tienda.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar golosinas, arroz, frijoles, aceite, jabón, chorizos, pollo y carne, para ofrecer más productos ya que la demanda es bastante. Con los ahorros desea invertirlos en la tienda y en los estudios de su hija.
texts.en: Candida is 62 years old and is married.  She runs her own store in her house, as she had noticed that there was a need in her neighborhood for a store that sold basic products.  Before this she cut up and sold pork, but now she works only in the store.  The loan that she is requesting is to buy snacks, rice, beans, oil, soap, sausage, chicken and meat, in order to offer more products, because the demand is high.  With her savings she would like to invest in the store, and in her daughter's education.

loans.use: to buy snacks, rice, oil, beans, soap, sausage, chicken and meat, in order to offer more products, because the demand is high.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is a 36-year-old married woman. She has one child who is 14 years old. She describes herself to be motivated. She operates a cosmetics and beauty shop where she sells beauty products. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a strategic place and her primary customers are ladies. 

Ann describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to add stock of necklaces, earrings and other beauty products. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to add stock of necklaces, earrings and other beauty products

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a 30-year-old married woman. She has one child who is four years old. She describes herself as self-driven and trustworthy. She operates a grocery store where she sells oranges. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in an easily accessible area conducive to business, and her primary customers are the common citizens. 

Margaret describes her biggest business challenge as lack of adequate funds. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of oranges for resale. Her business goal is to be a large scale supplier of vegetables within five years. She hopes that in the future, the business will diversify and generate great profits. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. The previous loan of KES 50,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of oranges for resale

loans.name: Rosa Idalia

texts.es:
Rosa, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo porque requiere de más capital de trabajo y por la buena atención que la Institución brinda; esta inversión le ayudara a comprar variedad de frutas y verduras, tales como: manzanas, uvas, naranjas, fresas, tomates, chiles, cebollas, yuca, rábanos, entre otros. 
Cuenta la Sra. Rosa que el crédito anterior le ayudo a fortalecer su negocio y con las ganancias ha logrado aportar a su familia, ya que su deseo es siempre apoyar a sus seres queridos y colocar otro negocio.
texts.en: Rosa has the need to take a new loan because she needs more working capital and because of the good service she gets from the Institution; this investment will help her buy a variety of fruits and vegetables, such as: apples, grapes, oranges, strawberries, tomatoes, peppers, onions, yucca, radishes, and others.  She indicates that the previous loan helped her strengthen her business and with the earnings she has been able to contribute to her family, as her wish is always to help her loved ones and start another business.

loans.use: to buy apples, grapes, oranges, strawberries, tomatoes, peppers, onions, yucca, radishes, and others.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is from Gata Diot, Clarin. She is 29 years old, married and has one child. To make a living, Florence has been managing a transportation service, while her husband is a driver. 

Florence successfully repaid her previous loans, which she used to improve her existing vehicle. She is requesting a new loan of 26,000 PHP to buy a new set of tires. She plans to save the additional revenue generated from the loan as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to buy a new set of tires

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a 26-year-old single man. He describes himself as determined. He operates a beauty salon where he offers hair dressing services, e.g., hair treatment, plaiting, etc. 

He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in an area that is good for business, and his primary customers are local residents. 

He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of money to expand his business. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy hair braids and other items for use in the beauty salon. His business goal is to expand to a hair dressing college within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy hair braids and other items for use in the beauty salon.

loans.name: Ana María Rutis

texts.es:
Ana de 54 años de edad,  es viuda con dos hijos de 37 y 19 años; pero solo la hija menor vive con ella, el mayor es un hombre y vive fuera del país. Por lo que Ana solo vive con su hija menor y su madre.


Ella es sastre desde hace 14 años, oficio que aprendió de su madre. En vista que este negocio le generaba buenos resultados, decidió inscribirse en una academia de sastrería para adquirir mejores conocimientos y perfeccionar la técnica, su hija en ocasiones le ayuda para aprender y su horario de trabajo es de casi todo el día. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar botones, ziperes, tela, hilos, entre otros materiales para confeccionar sus costuras. De esta manera, dispondrá de insumos suficientes para seguir elaborando sus costuras y sacar los pedidos que tiene satisfaciendo la clientela y asegurando una entrada de dinero segura para su familia.
texts.en:
Ana is 54 years old, she is a widow and has two children ages 37 and 19; her youngest daughter lives with her, the oldest, a male, lives out of the country.  Ana only lives with her daughter and her mom.

She's been a seamstress for 14 years, trade that she learned from her mother. Seeing that this business generated good results, she decided to sign up for seamstress academy to learn more skills and get the technique perfect, her daughter helps her sometimes and learns, her work schedule is almost all day.

The loan requested is to buy buttons, zippers, fabric, threads, and other materials needed for her creations.  This way, she will have sufficient raw materials to continue making her creations and fulfill the others she currently has, satisfying her customers and ensuring some cash coming in for her family.

loans.use: to buy buttons, zippers, fabric, threads, and other materials needed for her creations.

loans.name: Jamson

texts.en:
Jamson is a 37-year-old married man with one child living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He practices coffee and banana farming, which is how he earns a living. He also carries out goat-rearing to earn extra income. His businesses are located in a rural area. 

Jamson desires to educate his child to attain a degree as a minimum qualification. He also hopes to venture into modern farming for greater yields and wants to build a house. Jamson is requesting a loan to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers for his coffee plantation.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs

loans.name: Rosa Antonia

texts.es:
Rosa, se le presenta la necesidad optar por un nuevo préstamo, ya que requiere de más capital de trabajo para continuar con la elaboración y venta de pupusas; es inversión le ayudara a comprar la materia prima, tales como: harina, arroz, maíz, quesillo, aceite, chicharrón, gas, entre otros.
Comenta la Sra. Rosa que el crédito anterior le ayudo a incrementar los ingresos y optimizar sus inventarios. Las condiciones económicas han mejorado y las circunstancias familiares se mantienen igual.
texts.en:
Rosa came to us because she needs a new loan.  She needs more working capital in order to continue with her work in making and selling pupusas (a traditional Salvadoran dish made of a thick, handmade corn tortilla and filled with cheese, pork, or beans). This loan will help her buy the ingredients that she needs like flour, rice, corn, cheese, oil, chicharrón (pork cracklings), gas, and more.

Rosa says that her previous loan helped her increase the income from her business and to improve her inventory.  Her economic situation has also improved and her personal circumstances have remained the same.

loans.use: to buy flour, rice, corn, fresh cheese, oil, chicharrón (pork cracklings), gas, and more.

loans.name: Rene Alejandro

texts.es: Don René tiene 53 años de edad, esta casado, tiene un hijo de 17 años de edad el cual esta estudiando, vive en Puerto Cortes. Don René trabajaba anteriormente en una empresa privada. Ahora tiene su propia fuente de ingresos, desde hace mas de 3 años estableció una pulpería donde vende productos alimenticios como ser granos básicos como harina, churros, agua en bolsa, azúcar, manteca, arroz, frijoles, productos de abarrotes, refrescos etc. el préstamo que ha solicitado es el segundo ciclo y es por 8,000 Lempiras con el cual va comprar mas producto como carnes, harina, azúcar, churros, refrescos y granos básicos para vender y aumentar el inventario. Su meta es seguir trabajando para poder ampliar el negocio y surtirlo mejor para obtener mejores ingresos que le ayuden a darle el estudio a su hijo.
texts.en: René is 53, married, and has a 17-year-old son who is studying. He lives in Puerto Cortes. René previously worked in a private business. He now has his own source of income, since he established a grocery store three years ago, where he sells food products such as basic grains, flour, churros, bags of water, sugar, lard, rice, beans, grocery products, beverages, etc. The loan he has requested is his second and it is for 8,000 Lempiras. With it, he will buy more products such as meat, flour, sugar, churros, beverages and basic grains to sell and increase his inventory. His goal is to continue working in order to be able to expand the business and stock it better to obtain a better income, which will help him to provide for his son's studies.

loans.use: to buy products such as meat, flour, sugar, churros, beverages and basic grains to sell and increase his inventory

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
This is Rosemarie. Her previous loan was a big help in her business as she was able to buy the needed products for her variety store. Her income from business helped her in sending her child to school and in the family's everyday expenses. She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their everyday needs.

Rosemarie would like to apply for another loan of 50,000 PHP to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her child’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Rosemarie hopes that her business will continue to grow and dreams that her child will finish his studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week. There she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Yunguyo Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “YUNGUYO”  iniciará el décimo quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por diez integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Martha es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de verduras y queso, comidera, compra y venta de ropa, servicio de minibús, venta de tripas de vaca, venta de rellenos, venta de comida, tienda de barrio.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Martha es integrante, ella indica que hace quince años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación su sobrina que es socia de la institución y le comento de la forma de trabajo que se realiza. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de rellenos; este negocio lo inicio hace quince años ayudando a su cuñada a vender este productos, posteriormente decide establecer su propio negocio aprovechando su conocimiento en este rubro de negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es aumento de capital (compra de harina y garrafas) que adquirirá de las tiendas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo instalará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para su familia ya que ella vive en concubinato y tiene nueve hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The “Yunguyo” Association will start their 15th cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Pan-american Focus Center, it is formed by 10 members and managed by a board of directors where Martha is the President.  The businesses that the members of the community association have are varied, among them are: vegetables and cheese sales, restaurant, purchase and sale of clothing, minibus services, beef tripe sales, stuffing sales, food sales, convenience store.

The loan they'll take will benefit small micro entrepreneurs where Martha is a member, she indicates being part of Pro Mujer for 15 years, joining after an invitation from her niece, who is a member of the institution and explained the work they do.  She currently has a business of stuffing sales, she started it 15 years ago helping her sister-in-law sell these products, she later decided to start her own business taking advantage of the knowledge she had in this type of business.

The loan she will now take will be for working capital (to buy flour and containers) that she will buy in the stores of the city of El Alto and will later bring to her point of sale.  This type of work allows her to generate resources for her family, as she lives with her common law partner and has nine children.
When asked what she enjoys about Pro Mujer, she says she likes the courses about health and credit.

loans.use: to buy flour and containers

loans.name: Máximo Braulio

texts.es: El cliente es de la ciudad de Libertad.  Años atrás decidió trasladarse a la Península y posteriormente, establecerse ahí trabajando con su hermano en esta actividad.  Trabaja en el mercador desde temprano en la mañana hasta alrededor de las 4 pm.  No es casado y tampoco tiene hijos.  En un futuro le gustaría poder tener su local propio y trabajar junto con su familia.  Ahora necesita el préstamo para la compra de frutas y verduras para su negocio.
texts.en:
This borrower is from the city of Libertad.  Years ago, he decided to move to La Península and eventually established his own business where he works with his brother.  The borrower works at the market from the early morning hours to 4:00 P.M.  He is not married nor does he have any children.  In the future, he would like to have his own storefront where he can work with his family.

For now, the borrower needs a loan so that he can buy fruits and vegetables for his business.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en: Sylvia used her previous loan to buy fresh foods to sell. She is a hardworking woman with two children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She sells fresh foods and, with the proceeds, she has been able to provide the basics to her family. Lack of adequate preservation equipment causes most of her foods to go bad. Her dreams are to buy a refrigerator, educate her children up to the university level, and diversify her business to include farming activities. Sylvia intends to use this loan to buy fresh foods to sell.

loans.use: to buy fresh foods to sell.

loans.name: Aynura

texts.en:
Aynura is a very shy person and in the photo you can see her husband. 

Aynura is 29 years old and has two children. For the past seven years, she has been running a boutique and beautician business. She sells wedding dresses and does bridal makeup and manicure. 

Very often the brides invite her to do their makeup at their home. The car owned by her family needs to be repaired. She can't lose her customers, so it is very important for her to repair the car. For this purpose she is requesting the loan.

loans.use: to repair the car to facilitate her to go to brides homes and prep them for the wedding.

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en:
Rubina’s husband manufactures PVC pipes for sanitation. He takes orders and, based on demand, manufactures pipes. He has been doing this business for many years and earns a healthy income. He wants to provide all facilities and higher education to his children. He wants to prove himself a good husband and a good father.

Rubina requested a loan for her husband’s business so that her husband will be able to improve his income and make his dreams come true. She wants to pass her life with her family in a peaceful atmosphere where a shortage of money would not be happen. She will save the profit amount to meet any  sudden incidents and needs for household expenses. 

Rubina is 33 years old. She is the mother of four children. They live in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is very thankful to the Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy raw material for manufacturing PVC pipes, water and sanitary pipes.

loans.name: Xiomara

texts.es: Xiomara 47 años de edad madera soltera con seis hijos los cuales solo dos están bajo su protección , del domicilio norte de Chinandega del occidente del país ella dedica a la venta de cosméticos, ropa usada seleccionada negocio que posee desde hace 10 años, ha trabajado muy duro para poder darle un buen futuro a sus hijos, ella se entrega a su trabajo con tanto animo ya que ha sido el medio por el cual ha podido sacar adelante a sus hijos, sus compras las realiza en mercados de mayoreos las cuales son al contado y al crédito y las realiza de forma ambulante saliendo desde muy temprano recorriendo comarcas vecinas con un bolso pesando unos 10kilos, Xiomara actualmente solicita crédito para invertir en su negocio en la compra de: ropa, maquillajes, calcetas, faldas, camisas, chores, cintas entre otros porque ha subido su demanda por las festividades que se aproximan , ella está muy agradecida por la ayuda que los inversionistas Kivas le brindan a ella ya personas con escasos recursos y a países pobres como Nicaragua de tener un medio digno de trabajo.-
texts.en:
Xiomara is 47 years old and she is a single mother with six children that she cares for.  They live to the north of Chinandega in the western part of the country.  She sells cosmetics and used clothing.  She has had this business for 10 years and she works very hard in order to provide a good future for her children.

She puts all of her energy into her work because it is the only way that she can help her children get by.  She buys clothing in the major marketplaces for cash and then sells it door-to-door, beginning very early in the morning and traveling around neighboring areas carrying a 10 kg (22 lbs.) bag of clothes.

Xiomara is seeking a loan so that she can invest in her business by buying clothing, makeup, socks, skirts, shirts, belts, and other items, as demand has increased for these things due to the upcoming holidays.  

She is very thankful for the help provided by the Kiva lenders to herself, to people who lack economic resources, and to the poorer countries in the world like Nicaragua, as it enables people to find dignified work.

loans.use: to invest in her business; to buy t-shirts, skirts, shorts, socks, shoes, pants, and more.

loans.name: Jonny Javier

texts.es: El cliente vive en Machala.  Inició con sus padres en la pesca, comprándose una embarcación y desde entonces ha trabajado por ya casi 20 años.  Sale en la madrugada y según el aguaje puede quedarse de 2 a 3 días.  Es casado y tiene 3 hijos, uno de ellos estudia en la escuela fiscal del sector.  Necesita el dinero para invertirlo en la compra de mallas, tinas y otros artículos de pesca.
texts.en:
This borrower lives in Machala.  He started fishing with his parents and then purchased a boat.  Since then he has been working for almost 20 years.  He leaves at dawn and stays out at sea for two or three days based on the conditions.  The borrower is married and has three children, one of whom attends a state school in the area.  

He needs money so that he can invest in the purchase of nets, coolers, and other fishing supplies.

loans.use: to buy nets, coolers, and other fishing supplies.

loans.name: Fozilboy

texts.en:
Fozilboy is married and has one child to whom he has always wanted to provide a good quality of life. It’s for this reason that 10 years ago, he began his own business with driving. Thanks to his good service, he managed to gain many customers. 

Since he's had his business, his family’s quality of life has been improving. Now his child is able to get good education, and the financial challenges are being solved little by little.
