Martha es una persona humilde, que con mucho sacrificio esta ayudando a su familia y dándoles lo que necesitan para que no tengan que pasar por necesidades como las que ella tuvo que pasar. Se dedica a la venta de remedios naturales, o como es llamado en Paraguay, remedios yuyos. Es un trabajo sacrificado, pero por sobre todo muy digno.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertir en su negocio, y tener más remedios yuyos para la venta. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en: The San Juan group is on its ninth cycle with the women's communal bank program. They are resilient women, who though their efforts and the training that they receive, are trying to improve their lives and those of their families. They stand out in the neighborhood because they are united and stand in solidarity with each other. Martha is a humble person who, with a lot of sacrifice, is helping her family and giving them what they need so that they do not have to do without like she did. She works selling herbal remedies, or as they are called in Paraguay, "remedios yuyos". It is demanding work, but very dignified above all. She is asking for this loan to be able to invest in her business, and to have more herbal remedies to sell. She is grateful for this opportunity that will help her a lot.

loans.use: to buy herbal remedies to sell

loans.name: Del Pilar Group

texts.es:
El comité Del PILAR, son de la ciudad de Lambaré el grupo pasa al 2do ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas están luchando por salir adelante.
Sabina, una de ellas, se dedica a la venta de comidas que ella misma hace, comenta que es muy buena haciendo las comidas y que gracias a eso le está yendo muy bien. Es una persona muy trabajadora que está saliendo adelante con sacrificio. Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para poder seguir haciendo sus comestibles, como ser carnes, verduras, condimentos y demás, y así seguir ganándose el sustento diario.
texts.en:
The Del Pilar communal bank is from the city of Lambaré.  The group is in its second cycle in the women’s committee program.  All of them are struggling to get ahead.

Sabina is one of them.  She sells food that she makes herself.  She says that she is very good at making food, and thanks to this it is going very well for her.  She is a very hard-working person who, with sacrifice, is getting ahead.

She is requesting this loan in order to be able to buy supplies so that she is able to continue making her food.  She will buy things like meat, vegetables, condiments, and the rest.  This way she will continue earning the daily sustenance.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, condiments, and the rest.

loans.name: Ñepytyvo Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Ñepytyvo está haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, para poder conocer en qué situación se encuentran las integrantes. La encuesta mostró que 6 de ellas están con ingresos muy bajos, pero ellas son conscientes de que por medio de su trabajo y lucha podrán ir mejorando poco a poco.
Sandra es una persona muy trabajadora, que lucha y está tratando de salir adelante por medio de su trabajo. Ella es consciente que la única forma de poder salir adelante es por medio de su trabajo y su esfuerzo, es por eso que está dando todo de sí, para ir creciendo y mejorando.
Sandra solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas, ya que a eso se dedica y quiere dar una buena variedad a sus clientes. Agradece también por la oportunidad que recibe.
texts.en: The Ñepytyvo group is doing the poverty elimination survey to be able to understand the situation of each member. The survey showed that six of the members have low incomes, but they know that through their work and struggle, they will improve little by little. Sandra is a very hard-working person, who fights and is trying to move forward through her work. She knows that the only way to advance is through her work and effort. This is why she is giving her all to grow and improve. She is applying for this loan to be able to invest in the purchase of clothing, because this is her job and she wants to give a good variety to her customers. She is also thankful for this opportunity.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Genara

texts.en: Genara, 56 years of age is married and they are blessed with five children. She owns and has operated a retail store in their village for almost three years. Due to insufficient funds, she wanted to avail of a loan from those generous lenders amounting to Php 13,000 in order to purchase canned goods, noodles, breads, and beverages to sell. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she can earn more profits and improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, noodles, breads, and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Soledad Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SOLEDAD”  iniciará el quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Vanessa es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de juguetes, tejedora de chompas, artesanía en flores secas, venta de  comida, tejido de macramé y pollerería, copia y venta de CD’s, costura de chamarras, costura de deportivos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Vanessa es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación sus amiga que es socia de la institución y le comento de la forma de trabajo que se realiza. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de servicios de llamadas; este negocio lo inicio al observar el requerimiento de los vecinos de su zona y al observar que las tiendas no satisfacían el mercado.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de cabinas telefónicas) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de la Paz y posteriormente lo instalará en su espacio de servicio. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para su familia ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The “SOLEDAD”  communal bank is starting their fourth cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Panamericana regional office. It is made up of eight members, lead by a board of directors with Vanessa as their President. The businesses run by the members vary; the sale of toys, knitting sweaters, making dried flower handicrafts, selling food, making macrame and "polleria" (traditional shawls), copying and selling CD's, sewing jackets and making sports clothing. 
This loan which will benefit all these micro-entrepreneurs.

Vanessa indicated that she joined Pro Mujer two years ago, on the invitation of her friend who is a member of the institution and who commented on the way in which she worked.Today she operates a phone call center, which she opened observing the need for this service in her area and that the businesses operating did not satisfy the market demand.

Vanessa will use the loan to buy capital (buy telephone booths) that she will acquire in the markets of the city of La Paz and install them in her commercial space. This form of work allows her to generate the resources needed for her family, as she is married and has three children. When asked what she liked about Pro Mujer, she replied that she likes the training in health and loans.

loans.use: to buy telephone booths.

loans.name: Isidra

texts.en:
Isidra, 56,  is a widow with one child. She lives with her family in Calabayan, in the city of Ozamis, in the province of Misamis Occidental. 

To earn a living, Isidra owns and operates farmland, planting and harvesting bananas for sale.  She joined Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative in 2010 and has successfully repaid her previous loans, which contributed much to improving her farm. 

Isidra has requested a new loan of 4,500 Philippine pesos to purchase fertilizer, such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, such as manure.

loans.name: Maximina

texts.es: Máximina es una mujer viuda de 52 años que vive junto a su hijo Julián en su casa construida a base de adobe. Máximina se comprometió muy joven y junto a su esposo logró comprar un terreno de 2 hectáreas que le sirvió para mantener económicamente a su familia. Fue así que se inicio como agricultora produciendo cacao orgánico con los conocimientos que adquirió por sus padres ya que creció en el campo y es donde aprendió las técnicas necesarias para obtener una calidad muy comercial de este producto que es el más rentable de su región. Al quedar viuda y con la responsabilidad de cuidar a su hijo se sintió más motivada aún llegando a realizar su trabajo con la ayuda de trabajadores del lugar para las distintas tareas como el retiro de maleza y cosecha de las mazorcas. Al finalizar cada campaña productiva seca las almendras de cacao extraídas al aire libre y los lleva hasta los centro de venta ubicada en su localidad quienes se encargan de transportarlos hasta las grandes fabricas chocolateras de otra ciudad. Este es su segundo crédito con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para salir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En está oportunidad desea contar con 1,000 nuevos soles para la compra de abono orgánico y nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Máximina is a 52 year old woman who lives with her son Julian, in her adobe house.  Máximina married very young and she and her husband were able to buy a two acre piece of land with which to support her family.  This is how she began producing organic cacao, using the knowledge she learned from her parents and having grown up in the fields.  This is where she learned the necessary techniques to obtain a commercial quality product which is more profitable from her region.

She got more motivated when she became a widow and was left with the responsibility of caring for her son, so she does her work with the help of other workers who weed and harvest.  At the end of the season, she dries the cacao nuts outdoors and takes them to large chocolate producers in a different city.

This will be her second Kiva loan and she is grateful for the financial support that she gets to help her get ahead.  She is also committed to making her payments on time.  She is asking for a loan of 1,000 Nuevos Soles to buy compost to feed her crops.

loans.use: to buy compost.

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.en:
Antonieta is widowed and has four children. She lives in Gata Diot, in the municipality of Clarin, in the province of Misamis Occidental. To make a living, she owns  and operates a general store, selling a variety of products in the local community. 

In 2007, Antonieta joined Gata Daku Multi-purpose Cooperative and has successfully repaid her previous loans, which she used to improve her business. She is requesting another loan, of 50,000 Philippine pesos, to purchase more goods to sell, like school supplies, livestock feed and rice. 

She plans to use the additional revenue generated by the business to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell, like school supplies, livestock feed and rice.

loans.name: Benedicto

texts.en:
Benedicto is 44-years-old and married with three children. He is a farmer planting and harvesting rice to sell. He has been in the business for over 20 years and his usual gained income from farming is just enough to sustain his family needs. He has no other source of income than farming so this is why he patiently cultivates a plot of land in order to get a yield.

He wants to increase his production and somehow expand his land farming area.  However, he has insufficient funds so that is why he is asking for a loan in the amount of PHP 15,000 in order to develop his farm by buying fertilizers, insecticides and pesticides to maintain his farm. In the future, Benedicto hopes to harvest abundant crops in order to save funds for the family's growing expenditures and future business expansion.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, insecticides and pesticides to maintain his farm.

loans.name: Weena

texts.en:
Weena is married with two children. She is 28-years-old and lives in Sebac, Tudela, Philippines.

Weena sells charcoal in order to earn a living and has had this business for three years. Each month, she earns PHP 3,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 8,000 in order to have additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Weena has been a member of Kiva partner PMPC for one year.  In the future, Weena hopes to save for future consumption.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Gilberto

texts.en:
Gilberto is 55 years old and lives in Barra, Tudela, Philippines. He is married with two children. 

Gilberto works in the fish industry and catches fish for a living. He has been doing this for 10 years. He has requested a loan to purchase additional fishing materials such as fishing net, fishing rods, reels, line and sinkers.

Gilberto has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, he hopes to provide for the family's daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing materials such as fishing net, fishing rods, reels, line and sinkers

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 46 years old and lives in Palilan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children. 

Elsa is engaged in a fruit vending activity and earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to be used to purchase additional varieties of fruits for resale. 

Elsa has been a member of PMPC for eight years. In the future she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional varieties of fruits for resale

loans.name: Emman

texts.en:
Emman, 31 years old and single, lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. There, he has operated a motorcycle transport service for five years. He earns 25,000 PHP every month.

Emman joined GDMPC in 2009. He has successfully repaid his previous loan, which he used to repair his existing motorbike. Emman is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP, now. He will use this loan to cover the cost of motor registration renewal, and maintenance for the motorbike. He plans to use additional revenue generated from the business, to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to cover the cost of motor registration renewal, and maintenance of the motorbike

loans.name: Marc Jayson

texts.en: Marc Jayson is a third-year student at La Salle University in Ozamiz City. He lives in Sebasi, Clarin, Misamis Occidental with his family. He borrowed a new loan from Gata Daku MPC for the purpose of buying books and uniforms.  He dreams to finish his studies and be able to work for a bright future.

loans.use: buy books and uniforms.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth tiene 31 años de edad y es madre soltera de una hija de 6 años. Luego de pasar varios meses secuestrada por la organización al margen de la ley;  cuando recuperó su libertad, vio la necesidad de buscar opciones que le permitieran salir adelante por cuenta propia, pues le fue difícil encontrar oportunidades laborales. Es por ello que desde hace 8 años  montó su propio negocio, un almacén donde vende artículos para bebés, como juguetes, ropa, teteros y otros accesorios; el establecimiento se encuentra ubicado en un sector muy comercial y gracias a su trayectoria, ya cuenta con buen reconocimiento. La cliente cuenta con el apoyo de su madre y de las ventas que realiza, se derivan los ingresos para solventar las necesidades básicas de su familia. Elizabeth ha tenido que sobrepasar muchos obstáculos y situaciones difíciles, como las épocas de invierno y los problemas de orden público que a veces se generan, afecta directamente sus ventas y a nivel personal, aún tiene que seguir luchando con el trauma que quedó como secuela de su secuestro; sin embargo, poco a poco ha sabido reponerse y salir adelante. Actualmente solicita el crédito como apoyo, para invertirlo en la compra de surtido al por mayor (ropa, juguetes, accesorios, pañales) con el interés de comenzar a abastecerse y aumentar su inventario para la temporada navideña que se aproxima, pues ahora los costos son más reducidos y puede adquirir más productos, lo que se verá reflejado en el incremento de sus ventas y por ende, sus ingresos. De esta manera podrá tener la capacidad de brindar a su hija un mejor bienestar, además desea cumplir el sueño de ampliar su negocio, consolidarlo para que sea rentable y sostenible en el tiempo, pues desea que pase a su hija como una tradición familiar, con la que podrán mejorar su nivel de vida y disfrutarla en familia.
texts.en: Elizabeth, 31, is a single mother with a 6-year-old daughter. She spent several months held captive by an illegal organization. When she regained her freedom, she saw the need to look for options that would allow her to advance on her own, because it was difficult for her to find work opportunities. This is why eight months ago she started her own business, a store where she sells things for babies, like toys, clothing, bottles, and other accessories. The establishment is located in a very commercial area and thanks to the route, it is well-recognized. She has the support of her mother and the income from her sales goes to meet her family's basic needs. Elizabeth has had to overcome many obstacles and difficult situations, like the winter season and the public safety problems that sometimes surface. It directly affects her sales and on a personal level, she still has to struggle with trauma as a consequence of the kidnapping. However, little by little, she has been able to recover and move forward. Currently, she is asking for a loan as support, to invest in the purchase of wholesale merchandise (clothing, toys, accessories, diapers) with interest in starting to stock up and increase her inventory for the upcoming Christmas season. Now costs are lower and she can buy more products, which will be reflected in the increase of her sales, and ultimately, her income. This way, she will be able to give her daughter greater comfort. She also hopes to achieve her dream of expanding her business, strengthening it so that it if profitable and sustainable over time, because she hopes to pass it to her daughter as a family tradition, with which they can improve their quality of life and enjoy it as a family.

loans.use: to buy stock wholesale (clothing, toys, accessories, diapers)

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita, 55, is married and blessed with four children. She has been in the vegetable production business for almost 15 years. With this business, she earns a net income of 1,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) per week. 

Rosita would like to apply for a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase vegetable seedlings for her vegetable production business. She’s hoping that her business will be granted the loan so that her vegetable yard will become more fruitful and abundant.

loans.use: To purchase vegetable seedlings for her vegetable production business

loans.name: Encarnacion

texts.en:
Encarnacion is a Cagayana. She is married to a farmer and has three children. Together, they plant and harvest rice as the source of their living. Her income, generated from farming, is just enough to meet the educational needs of her children and some of their daily living costs, and what is left is rolled as capital into the business. In terms of farming capital, she admitted that really she is lacking it.

Thus, Encarnacion is now asking for a loan. She will use it to pay for land cultivation, and to buy fertilizer and insecticide for her rice field. This will help improve her farming business and eventually increase her harvest in the next season. Bigger harvests will improve the overall welfare of her family, someday.

loans.use: to pay for land cultivation, and to buy fertilizer and insecticide for her rice field.

loans.name: Cornelio

texts.en:
Cornelio lives in Pantaon, Ozamiz City, with his family. He is widowed and has four children. He gained a bigger harvest from his farm with the help of his previous loan from Gata Daku MPC, which he used to buy farm inputs.

Now, he requests a new loan, this time for 5,000 PHP. He will use the new loan to purchase fertilizer, such as manure. He plans to use the generated income to renovate his house.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, such as manure

loans.name: Librado

texts.en:
Librado is 53-years-old and lives in Tigdok, Tudela, Philippines. He is married with two children. 

Librado  works in the fish industry and catches fish for a living. He has been doing this for eight years. He has requested a loan in order to purchase additional fishing materials such as fishing nets, fishing rods, reels, lines and sinkers.

Librado has been a member of Kiva partner PMPC for three years. In the future, Librado hopes to save for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing materials such as fishing nets, fishing rods, reels, lines and sinkers.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy is an industrious mother and raises hogs for a living. Doing the business allows her to save a little for the future of her four children. This really matters to her because the only legacy that she can give to her children is the essence of education. To achieve it, she ensures the good health and nutrition of her raised hogs. This is the reason why she is requesting additional capital of PHP 10,000 to be used to buy hog feed, medicine and vaccine for the further maintenance of her pigs. She really hopes to achieve her loan requests to make further development in her business.

loans.use: to buy hog feed, medicine and vaccine for her pigs

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is married without children. She is 52 years old and lives in Gata Daku, Clarin, Philippines.

Victoria sells a variety of products to earn a living and has had this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns PHP 2000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 7000 to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergent, soap, etc.

Victoria has been a member of PMPC for five months. In the future, she hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergent, soap, etc.

location.town: Tudela-Gata Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Mind

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine raises pigs as her family's primary source of income. At 47, she is still dreaming of a comfortable living with her family. That’s why she dedicates herself to making improvements in the hog-raising business that she has. The piggery business for her is a good source of income as long as she provides patience and good care. To provide the essential needs of her pigs, she is requesting a loan to buy feed, vaccine and vitamins. This would be helpful in nourishing her pigs' growth and will definitely give her high income towards the fulfillment of her dream.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccine and vitamins for the maintenance of her hogs.

loans.name: Víctor José

texts.es: Víctor tiene 65 años de edad, es casado y padre de 2 hijos. Es pensionado y con algunos ahorros inició su negocio, un almacén de pinturas, disolventes y accesorios para acabados, dispone de equipos para hacer mezclas y sacar más tonos y nuevos colores; cuenta con el apoyo de 2 empleados directos y goza de reconocimiento en diferentes pueblos y latonerías de la región por su especialidad en pinturas para vehículos.  Su negocio inició hace un año y trabaja de Lunes a Sábado de 8:00 am a 6:00 pm. Víctor no contaba con experiencia en este tipo de negocios, pero aprovechó el conocimiento de sus empleados, quienes le han ido enseñando las diferentes técnicas y conceptos necesarios. Actualmente solicita el crédito con el ideal de invertirlo en la compra de surtido (pinturas, disolventes) y comprar activo fijo (equipo mezclador), con esto podrá ofrecer a sus clientes más variedad de tonos y colores y prestará un servicio de mejor calidad, con el que podrá seguir siendo reconocido y se verá reflejado en el incremento de sus ventas y sus ingresos, lo que le permitirá posicionarse en el mercado y ser más competitivo. Víctor sueña con montar otras sucursales en otros municipios de la región y generar más oportunidades de empleo, esto le ayudará a mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y disfrutar de un futuro próspero y estable.
texts.en: Victor is 65 years old. He is married and is the father of two children. He is retired, and with some savings he began his business, a store that sells paints, solvents, and accessories for finishing. He has equipment to make mixtures and obtain more tones and new colors. He has the help of two direct employees, and he enjoys recognition in different towns and metal-working shops in the region because of his specialty of paints for vehicles. He began his business a year ago and he works from Monday to Saturday from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm. Victor did not have experience in this type of business, but he took advantage of the knowledge of his employees, who have been teaching him the different techniques and concepts needed. Now he is applying for the loan with the goal of investing it in the purchase of stock (paints, solvents) and buying fixed assets (mixing equipment). With this he will be able to offer his customers a greater variety of tones and colors and will provide better quality service, with which he will be able to continue being recognized, and this will be reflected in an increase in his sales and his income, which will allow him to position himself in the market and be more competitive. Victor dreams of setting up other branches in other towns in the region and generating more opportunities for employment. This will help him to improve the living conditions of his family and enjoy a prosperous and stable future.

loans.use: to buy stock (paint, solvents) and fixed assets (mixing equipment)

loans.name: Ariunbold

texts.en:
Mr. Ariunbold, 34 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been working as an electrician at the department of water and electricity supply, of the railway authority, since 2011. His wife works as an auditor at a financial services company.

Recently, Ariunbold decided to launch a new service business, which will include the installation of electricity distribution equipment, upon orders from his clients. For this new business, he is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 MNT, which he will use to buy one equipment, for a trial. If it succeeds, he wants to continue to install that equipment into households. The borrower is a very hardworking individual. Because his two children are growing bigger each day, he is very concerned with being able to meet their needs.

loans.use: to purchase electricity distribution equipment, to try the feasibility of a new business

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en:
Hog-raising is the primary source of income for Mary Joy and her family. She is 41, and resides in the village of Mabbayad. She is married to Francisco, a father who works hard, as a farmer. The couple is thankful, because they have been blessed with two children.

Mary Joy has been raising pigs for three years and earns PHP 2,500 per piglet, when sold. Mary Joy is asking for a loan of PHP 7,000. She will use the loan to buy feed, vaccines, and vitamins to sustain the proper growth of her hogs. She is hoping that her loan request will be granted, so she will be able to develop her business more.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines, and vitamins to sustain the proper growth of her hogs.

loans.name: Levie

texts.en:
Levie, 39 years of age, married and blessed with two children. She manages a junk shop business for almost two years and earns a net income of 2,000 PHP weekly. 

She decided to request a loan of 13,000 Philippines Peso (PHP) to purchase scrap materials and plastic bottles to sell. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that her business will become more profitable and progressive.

loans.use: to purchase scrap materials and plastic bottles to sell.

loans.name: Sitren

texts.en:
Sitren, age 30, lives in a rural village in the Sampov Meas District. She has two dependent children – one of whom is in school, while the remaining one is too young for school. She is a rice farmer who grows rice on 2.5 hectares of farmland, while her husband is a paid worker. Having been in this business for ten years, Sitren is able to earn about 60,000 riels (KHR) per day to meet the family’s needs.

Sitren has been with VisionFund for one cycle and completely paid back her past loan, which has helped her relieve their financial burden and improve their livelihood. Now she is requesting a new loan of 610,000 KHR to buy a hand tractor for supporting her paddy business. She hopes to make more income from her rice paddy, so as to make a better living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy a hand tractor for supporting her paddy business

loans.name: Oscar Javier

texts.es: Oscar tiene 31 años de edad, es padre de un hijo de 3 años y vive en unión libre con su pareja. Actualmente se dedica a atender su negocio, una tienda de abarrotes, la cual lleva 7 años de funcionamiento y la obtuvo como herencia, luego del fallecimiento de su madre. Él trabaja solo, de Lunes a Domingo de 8:00 am a 9:00 pm. El cliente solicita el crédito con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de surtido al por mayor (productos lácteos, mecato, granos, pastas, entre otros productos de la canasta familiar), de esta manera tendrá más inventario diverso con el que puede satisfacer los gustos y necesidades de sus clientes, así podrá aumentar sus ventas y los ingresos que recibe.  Oscar sueña con adquirir un local más grande y en una zona más comercial, en el que pueda  establecer su negocio y aumentar su clientela, lo que le permitirá recibir más recursos con los que dará mejor bienestar y calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en: Oscar, 31, is the father of a three-year-old son and lives in a common-law marriage with his partner. Currently he works managing his business, a grocery store. It has been in operation for seven years and he gained it as an inheritance after the death of his mother. He works alone, from Monday to Sunday from 8:00 am until 9:00 pm. He is asking for this loan to buy wholesale stock (dairy products, cakes, grains, pastas, among other basic staples). This way, he will have more varied inventory with which to meet the tastes and needs of his customers. So he will be able to increase his sales and the income that he makes. Oscar dreams of having a bigger establishment in a more commercial zone, in which he can establish his business and increase his customer base. This will allow him to have more resources with which he will give his family greater comfort and a greater quality of life.

loans.use: to buy wholesale stock (dairy products, cakes, grains, pastas, among other basic staples)

loans.name: Apolinar Enrique

texts.es: Apolinar tiene 54 años y vive con su esposa. Desde muy joven se ha dedicado a las labores del campo, pues ha sido una tradición familiar y sus padres le enseñaron todo lo que hoy sabe. Actualmente posee cultivos en la finca donde reside, cuyas cosechas son recolectadas y vendidas en el mercado del pueblo,  además presta el servicio de cortes con motosierra, de esta manera ha obtenido los ingresos para llevar al sustento a su familia. El cliente es un señor pujante, trabajador y cada día lucha con esmero para sobrepasar los obstáculos que se le presentan, especialmente los que afectan sus cultivos, como por ejemplo el clima cambiante y los altos costos de los insumos que requiere para cuidar sus cultivos, sin embargo ha sabido salir adelante y seguir progresando. Actualmente solicita el crédito con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de insumos agrícolas (abonos, pesticidas, fertilizantes y semillas) con lo que podrá seguir cuidando su cultivo y preparar la tierra para que la cosecha sea más productiva, así aumentará sus ingresos y podrá brindar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una estabilidad económica favorable.
texts.en: Apolinar is 54 years old and lives with his wife. He has done farm work since he was very young, since it has been a family tradition, and his parents taught him everything that he knows today. Now he has crops on the farm where he lives, whose harvests are collected and sold in the market in the town. In addition, he offers chainsaw services. In this way he has obtained the income to bring sustenance to his family. This borrower is a vigorous and hard-working man, and every day he strives conscientiously to overcome the obstacles that he faces, especially those that affect his crops, such as the changing climate and the high costs of the supplies that he needs to care for his crops. Nevertheless, he has known how to advance and continue progressing. Now he is applying for the loan with the goal of investing it in the purchase of agricultural supplies (compost, pesticides, fertilizers, and seeds), with which he will be able to continue caring for his crops and prepare the land so that the harvest will be more productive. Thus he will increase his income and will be able to offer his family a better quality of life and a favorable economic stability.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies (compost, pesticides, fertilizers, and seeds)

loans.name: Altantsag

texts.en:
Mrs. Altantsag is 51 years old and lives with her younger son, brother and his family in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. Using her previous loan, she and her brother completed their three year house building effort. She is now requesting a loan of 2,500,000 MNT to purchase vacuum insulated windows, hardwood floors and fiberglass. Installment of windows and the floor will ensure the family has a comfortable and warm place to live. Heat was lost through windows and the wind was seeping through the floors during previous winters. Reduced coal usage for heating will contribute to the efforts to decrease air pollution.  

Her younger son is recently employed at an automobile washing center. Her brother has been working as a machinist since 2011 and his wife stays at home looking after their children. Altantsag retired from work and gets state pension.

loans.use: to buy hardwood floors, vacuum insulated windows and fiberglass.

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezel, 33 years of age, married and blessed with two children. She manages a retail store business where she sells livestock feeds and some bags of rice. 

Due to the lack of capital, she wanted to request a loan of 10,000 Philippines Peso (PHP) to purchase hog and chicken feeds and bags of rice to sell. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that her retail business will grow and improve more so that she can earn more profits.

loans.use: to purchase hog and chicken feeds and bags of rice to sell.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan de 63 años, no estudio, es casado; la esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tienen en común 5 hijos los cuales ya tienen sus hogares aparte.  Se dedica a la agricultura, siembra de maíz frijol y maicillo tiene 42 años de dedicarse a la agricultura; la actividad la aprendió desde muy pequeño y se dedico a eso porque no encontró otra forma de ayudarle a su familia. 

Con el préstamo comprara abono, herbicidas. Para ayudar a producir una mejor cosecha y se tendrá el alimento para la familia la necesidad a satisfacer será la obtención de la alimentación através de la agricultura.
Su sueño es producir mejores cosechas de maíz y frijol y para su familia que vivan de una forma digna,  espera darle a sus hijos educación, porque es el camino para que ellos se superen y sean en su futuro personas de bien.
texts.en:
Juan is 63 years old and married; he didn’t go to school. His wife is a housekeeper. They have 5 children who live on their own. He works in the agricultural sector growing corn, beans, and sorghum. He’s been a farmer for 42 years. He learned how to farm when he was little, and he does this work because he doesn’t know any other way to support his family. 

He’ll buy manure and herbicides with this loan to help produce a better crop and provide food for his family. He needs to be able to get food via farming. 

His dream is to produce a better crop of corn and beans to that his family can live in a dignified way. He wants to provide his children with an education because that’s the way for them to improve themselves and become good people.

loans.use: to buy manure and herbicides to produce a better harvest.

loans.name: Liliana

texts.es: Liliana tiene 28 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos. Toda su vida la ha pasado en el campo, donde aprendió desde muy joven, las labores agropecuarias, gracias a las enseñanzas de sus padres; esto le ha servido para generar ingresos que solventan las necesidades básicas del hogar, ya que posee un galpón, donde cría y engorda pollos para luego venderlos. La cliente es una mujer enérgica, activa y trabajadora, siempre va en busca de mejores opciones que le permitan seguir avanzando. Solicita el crédito con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de concentrados y vitaminas para alimentar los animales, con lo que podrá venderlos a un mejor precio de acuerdo al peso; así mejorará los ingresos que recibe para seguir aportando a la economía de su familia y velar por el bienestar de sus padres. Liliana sueña con ampliar su galpón y adquirir más animales, para tener una producción escalonada, que le brinde una estabilidad económica, además desea formar una familia y tener hijos, para disfrutar junto a ellos de mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Liliana, 28, is single and has no children. She has spent her whole life in the country, where she learned farm work from the time she was very young, thanks to the teachings of her parents. This has helped her to generate income that meets her basic household needs, since she has a chicken house where she raises and fattens chickens to sell. She is an energetic, active, and hard-working women, always searching for better options that will let her continue to move forward. She is applying for this loan with the goal of buying feed and vitamins to feed the animals, with which she will be able to sell them for a better price according to their weight. This way, she will improve the income that she receives to continue contributing to her family's household economy and watching over her parents' wellbeing. Liliana dreams of expanding her chicken house and buying more animals, in order to have staggered production, which will bring her economic stability. She also wants to start a family and have children, in order to enjoy better living conditions alongside them.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins to feed the animals

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman who lives in her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Mary has operated a vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of stiff competition from other vegetable operators in her business.
 
With the KSh 10,000, she wants to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruits and green vegetables for resale.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruits and green vegetables for resale

loans.name: Lelys Del Carmen

texts.es: Lelys tiene 39 años de edad, es madre de un hijo de 4 años y vive en unión libre con su compañero sentimental. Desde hace 8 años se dedica a la confección, actividad que inició debido a la dificultad para conseguir oportunidades de empleo y a la difícil situación económica por la que atravesaba su familia. Su taller está ubicado en la casa donde reside y allí ofrece el servicio de confección a terceros, de esta manera ha logrado adquirir los recursos para solventar las necesidades básicas de su hogar. La cliente es una mujer dedicada a su familia y a su labor, pujante y se esmera para brindarle siempre lo mejor a su hijo. Esto la motiva a solicitar el apoyo del crédito, pues desea comprar insumos al por mayor (telas, hilos, botones, elásticos), con el fin de darle continuidad a su negocio y aumentar su producción con la cual podrá satisfacer la demanda que posee, aún cuando ha tenido dificultades con las entregas oportunas, pues algunos proveedores se demoran con la entrega de la materia prima, sin embargo ha tenido la capacidad de cumplirle a sus clientes. Lelys sueña con ampliar su taller y generar más oportunidades de empleo para madres cabeza de hogar, con lo que podrá mejorar la calidad de vida tanto de su familia, como la de otras personas que influyen en el desarrollo de su labor.
texts.en: Lelys is 39 years old.  She is the mother of a 4 year old son and lives in a common-law relationship with her partner.  For eight years, she has been engaged in sewing, an activity she began because of difficulty finding employment and the financial difficulties her family was going through.  Her workshop is located in her house and there she offers sewing services to third parties.  In this way, she has managed to acquire the resources she needs to meet basic household needs.  Lelys is a woman devoted to her family and to her work.  She is strong and tries her best to always offer her son the best.  She is requesting the support of this loan because she wants to purchase wholesale supplies (fabric, thread, buttons, elastic) for the purpose of continuing her business and increasing production to satisfy the demand that she has.  Even though she has had difficulties with timely deliveries, as some providers are slow with delivery of raw material, she has been able to deliver to her customers.  Lelys dreams of expanding her workshop and generating employment opportunities for single mothers, which may improve the quality of life of her family as well as the lives of other families that influence the development of her work

loans.use: to purchase wholesale supplies (fabric, thread, buttons, elastic).

loans.name: Idania Elizabeth

texts.es: Idania, tiene 28 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposo con quien tiene 2 hijos y vive en el Municipio de San Pedro Sula. Ella tiene su propio negocio de una pulpería desde hace 16 años aproximadamente. El negocio lo tiene establecido en su casa y le dedica todo el día ya que es su fuente de ingresos. vende productos alimenticios como ser harina, azúcar, pan, churros, carnes, embutidos, especies, manteca etc. ha solicitado el segundo préstamo con ODEF y es por 5,000 Lempiras, con el cual va surtir un poco el negocio de productos alimenticios como carnes, lácteos, refrescos, granos básicos y otros que necesite. Tiene como meta seguir trabajando para brindar un mejor nivel de vida a su familia.
texts.en: Idania is 28 years old, is in a common law marriage and they live with their two children in the city of San Pedro Sula.  She has had her own business, a convenience store, for about 16 years.  Her business is out of her home, she works it daily, and it's her source of income.  She sells food such as flour, sugar, bread, churros, meats, sausages, spices, lard, etc.  This will be her second loan through ODEF and she will use the 5,000 Lempiras to stock her store with food products such as meat, milk products, soft drinks, basic grains, and other things she needs.  Her goal is to continue working to provide a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Janeth Maribel

texts.es: La cliente reside en la ciudad de Machala.  La cliente empezó en este de negocio a partir de que tuvo su primer hijo y luego su papá le regaló dinero para que lo invierta en alguna actividad productiva.  Trabaja sola todos los días y realiza su recorrido desde la mañana.  Es madre soltera y tiene un hijo de 2 años.  Ella desea a futuro tener su local propio y que su hijo la pueda ayudar con el negocio.  Desea el préstamo para invertirlo en cosméticos, perfumes y desodorantes.
texts.en:
This borrower resides in the city of Machala.  She started her business after she had her first child.  With the money that her father had given her, she invested it in a productive activity.  The borrower works alone every day and conducts her business starting in the mornings.  She is a single mother and has a two-year-old son.  In the future, she wants to have her own shop where her son can help her with the business.  

She wants to invest this loan in cosmetics, perfumes, and deodorants.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, perfumes, and deodorants.

loans.name: Jiungeni Group

texts.en:
Zulfa is in her mid 30s, widowed with five children.  Two of her children are grown-ups and three are still going to school.  She has been buying broiler chicken which she fries and then sells.  She works from 6:00 am to 6:00 pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be her sixth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to buy more stock of chicken. She started with five pieces but now she can manage to buy thirty pieces.  She has paid back all of her loans successfully.  She used the profit to pay school fees and cover household expenses. She is doing fine and is happy with the loan which has helped her to make a living without a husband.  She will use the loan to buy more chicken, cooking oil and charcoal for the business.  Her dream is to one day build her own house.

Zulfa will share this loan with her loan group "Jiungeni" with nine members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more chicken, cooking oil and charcoal for the business.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is a married woman and blessed with six children who are adults. She lives at her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. 

Mwanasha weaves mats using palm leaves and sells them at the market. She cites seasonality and stiff competition as her major challenges.

With the 10,000 Kenya Shilling (KES), she wants to purchase palm leaves for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase palm leaves for her business.

loans.name: Bargigul

texts.ru: Баргигул добросовестная женщина. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 6 детей. Она уже более 6 лет имеет свой бизнес. Баргигул занимается изготовлением и продажей лепешек. Она имеет свой цех, где она печет в национальной печке «танур» лепешки. Баргигулу по введению бизнеса помогают ее сыновья. С данного бизнеса она получает доход, который обеспечивает всю семью. Она выдала свою дочь замуж и скоро будет ее свадьба. Однако Баргигул не имеет денег, чтобы провести свадебное торжество своей дочери. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 7500 сомони для проведения свадебного торжества своей дочери. Она является повторной клиентом ИМОН и имеет хорошее кредитное досье. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие. Этот займ поможет ей сделать счастливой ее дочь.
texts.en:
Bargigul is a conscientious woman who is married and raising six children.  She has been running her own business for more than six years, preparing and selling small cakes in her own shop.  She bakes her cakes in a traditional Tajik oven called a "tanur".  Her sons help her run the business.  The income she derives from this activity supports her whole family.

Bargigul has already promised her daughter for marriage and the wedding celebration is coming up soon.  However, she doesn't have the money to pay for her daughter's wedding party.  She is therefore requesting a loan of 7,500 somoni to pay for this event.

Bargigul has already taken loans from IMON and has a good credit history.  She is awaiting your kindness and relying on your charity, as this loan will make her daughter very happy.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's wedding party.

loans.name: Rosette

texts.en:
Rosette is a 42-year-old divorced woman with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. Sixteen years ago, she decided to start a retail shop to support her children after she divorced her husband and shouldered all the burden.

Like most traders, she is challenged by price fluctuations and inadequate capital to meet the high demand. Her dream is to trade in wholesale. Rosette intends to use the loan to buy salt, soda, and water to sell.

loans.use: to buy salt, soda, and water to sell.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is 50 years of age, married and with two children who attend school which is the reason for her hard work.  She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. 

Mariam has sold khangas (women's wrap clothes) as a business from her home for the past ten years, selling to passersby and neighbors. 

With the 10,000 Kenyan Shillings, she wants to purchase bales of khangas (women's wrap clothes) for resale. She joined Yehu Microfinance Trust for financial support.

loans.use: to purchase khangas (women's wrap clothes) for resale.

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha appreciates for the previous loan she took from kiva that improved her living standards. She operates a food stall business. 

She is requesting a loan of 10,000 Kenya Shilling (KES) to purchase beans, rice, tomatoes, and onions for her business.

She thanks Yehu and Kiva for financial support.

loans.use: to purchase beans, rice, tomatoes, and onions for her business.

loans.name: Zawadi

texts.en:
Zawadi is a married woman who has been blessed with seven children.  She lives in her own house that is without electricity and piped water.  For over ten years, she has operated a posho mill business, grinding cereals such as maize.  She cites machine breakdown as her major challenge.

With the 20,000 KES she wants to purchase spare parts and diesel for the grinding machine.  She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and diesel for the grinding machine.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en: Pauline appreciates the previous loan that she got from Kiva.  It improved her living standards.  She is requesting for a loan of 50,000 KES to purchase poultry feed and chicks.  She thanks Yehu and Kiva for their loan policy.

loans.use: to purchase poultry feed and chicks.

loans.name: Afzal

texts.en:
Mr. Afzal is a 57-year-old man from Pakistan.  Since 2000, Afzal has been running his own electrical goods shop near his house.  It is a very successful business for his family.  He sells tailoring machines, coolers, washing machines, and fans in his shop. 

He is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan.  He is currently in need of purchasing five washing machines to sell.  But, due to financial constraints, he finds it difficult.  Therefore, he has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan.  This will increase his net income and savings.  He is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase five washing machines to sell.

loans.name: Mawela Group

texts.en:
Juston is a 30-year-old married man with a boy and a girl, who are in school.  Since 2003, Juston has been running a photography business.  He works from 9am to 8pm daily and is able to make a small return per month.  From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is Juston's 10th loan request.  He used the previous loans to buy a big camera.  He has paid back all his previous loans successfully.  Juston used his business profit to cover home expenses and school fees.  He will use this loan to start selling bananas up country.  Juston dreams that one day will be able to expand his business and build a house.

He will share this loan with his loan group, ‘Mawela’, which totals 10 members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to start selling bananas up country.

loans.name: Njira

texts.en: Njira is grateful for the financial support from Kiva.  She is requesting a 30,000 KES loan to purchase six goats for the business.  She thanks Yehu and Kiva for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase six goats.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 41-year-old married father of six.  He is their sole breadwinner in addition to his wife's needs.

Ali works in a car washing company since 2009.  This is his only source for living.  He is applying for a loan from Al Majmoua to pay for the necessary maintenance of his car which facilitates his transportation.  This loan is very important to him and for his family's needs.

He hopes that one day he will be capable of starting his own business, which will improve his socioeconomic situation.

loans.use: to pay for car maintenance.

loans.name: Kadzo

texts.en:
Kadzo appreciates that her previous loan enabled her to improve her living standards.  In her stall she sells home products, cereals, vegetables and fruits.
She is requesting for a loan of 10,000 Kenyan Shillings to purchase tomatoes, onions, vegetables and potatoes for her business.  She joined Yehu Microfinance Trust to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes, onions, vegetables and potatoes for her business.

loans.name: Ghassan

texts.en:
Ghassan is a 41-year-old married father of three children.  He is responsible for their living in addition to his wife's living.  He works as a butcher since fifteen years ago.  He opened his present shop in 2010 in order to improve his family's socioeconomic situation.

Ghassan is applying for a loan from Al Majmoua to pay off his van, which he uses to transport his meat and necessary butchery needs from the wholesale trade to his shop.  This is his first time as an Al Majmoua borrower.  He has so much hope that this loan and the future planned ones will come with positive results, such as expanding and developing his business easily.  He is working hard to diversify his business and he might open a sandwich shop in the future.

loans.use: to pay off his van.

loans.name: Mnyazi

texts.en:
Mnyazi is married, and has four children who are adults. She lives in her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past ten years, she has operated a goat selling business. She sells to the market. Her major challenge is the high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the 10,000 KES (Kenya Shilling), she wants to purchase goats for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase goats for resale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is married and has seven children.  She lives in her own house that is without electricity and piped water.  Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.  For the past fifteen years, she has operated a poultry selling business.  She sells to her neighbors and passersby.  Her major challenge is the high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the 10,000 KES loan she wants to purchase chicks and poultry feed.  She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feed.

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.ru: Мухаббат хранительница очага своего дома и единственная надежда своих детей. Она разведена и сама воспитывает своих 2 детей. После окончания средней школы она не смогла поступить в университет по семейному состоянию. Она научилась у портнихи шитью и кройки женской одежды. Уже более 15 лет она занимается предоставлением услуги швеи. Она имеет свой цех, где она предоставляет услуги швеи. Мухаббат сама справляется с бизнесом, так как ее дети еще не совершеннолетние. Мухаббат уже несколько лет хочет отремонтировать свой дом, но не может сделать сбережения, так как она тратит свои деньги для обеспечения семьи. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1000 долларов США для покупки строительных материалов, как цемент, древесина и т.п. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Muhabbat is a homemaker and her children's only hope.  She is divorced and raises her two children by herself.  She completed secondary school, but was not able to go to a university because of her family situation.  Instead, she learned to cut and sew women's clothes from a seamstress, and she has now been involved in this activity for more than 15 years.  She provides sewing services in her own shop and runs her business by herself, since her children are still young.

Muhabbat has dreamed about renovating her house for a few years now, but she can never save enough money for repairs, as she spends everything to provide for her family.  She is requesting a loan of 1,000 USD to buy building materials such as cement and wood.  She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as cement and wood to repair her house.

loans.name: Shareen

texts.en:
Shareen is a 39-year-old married man. He is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan.  For the past many years, Shareen has been in the clothing business.  He loves his family and his life ambition is to provide better facilities to his family.  The clothing business is the key to fulfill all of his family's needs.

He is running this business by purchasing variety of clothes from different areas and selling them in his shop. Shareen has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase a variety of un-stitched clothes to sell.  Currently he does not have new varieties to offer to his customers so the number of his customers is decreasing day by day.  People prefer to purchase new varieties for new seasons and he do not have new variety to attract customers, so this is reducing his product selling and net income. 

The Kiva loan would help him to replace the old stock of the shop with new variety.  This would be helpful for him to attract a huge number of customers and to increase his net income. He is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase new variety of unstitched clothing.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 32-year-old single man who has eighteen years of experience in a car wash. In 2008, he opened his own shop to improve his living and widen his working zone.
Ali is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to pay the price for new tools to develop his working habits and serve his clients in a better way.  His shop is very small, but he hopes to develop his business in a well-managed way so it will service an increased number of cars, grow into a larger shop and eventually start a modern automatic car wash.

loans.use: to pay the price for new tools for his car wash.

loans.name: Clauvis

texts.en:
Clauvis is a young Cameroonian age 33. He is married with six children - the oldest is eleven and in secondary school and the youngest is six and in primary school. 

He has been in his business for the past three years, which makes him very experienced and stable. His business is successful because it is located in an urban area where they bake bread, which makes the demand for firewood very high. 

He is likely to succeed because the demand for firewood is very high where his business is located. This loan will help him increase his revenue from 120,000 XAF to 397,000 XAF and his profit will increase by 25% per month. 

His standard of living will increase as well.

loans.use: to buy wood to split and sell.

loans.name: Godofredo

texts.es:
Don Godofredo de 43 con un nivel académico de 6° grado, agricultor,  casado y padre de 5 cinco de 22, 20, 18, 15 y 8 años de edad. Actualmente dependen solo 4  hijos y un nieto.


Se desempeña en la agricultura desde la edad de 15 años, el trabajo lo aprendió con su papá nunca se ha dedicado a otro trabajo tampoco tiene otras actividades económicas. Trabaja junto a su familia, el lugar en donde tiene sus cultivos esta a 15 minutos de la casa, trabaja  cinco horas diarias.

Con el préstamo solicitado a fundación CAMPO comprara  abono, y pagara quien le ayude a la preparación de la tierra, para sembrar chile, ejotes, tomate y pipianes  tendrá más producción, por lo que en ese momento va poder comprar lo más vital para su vida y estará satisfecho porque cultivara lo que el tiene.

Sus sueños son el preparar en sus estudios a sus hijos y sacarlos adelante  que todos los recursos que lleguen los inviertan en algo productivo y que en el siguiente año siempre tenga el apoyo de alguna institución.
texts.en: Godofredo is 43 with a sixth-grade education. A farmer, he is married with five children, ages 22, 20, 18, 15 and 8. Currently, four children and a grandson are dependents. He has made a living in farming since he was 15 years old. He learned the trade from his father, and he hasn't worked nor made money in any other activity. He works alongside his family on land about 15 minutes from home. He works five hours a day. With the loan, he plans to purchase fertilizer and pay for help to prepare his land to plant chili peppers, green beans, tomatoes and squash and increase his production. At the moment, he needs to buy what he needs most, and he will be satisfied because he will grow what he has. Godofredo's dreams are for his children to get an education and keeping making headway with all the resources they need to be productive, and to always have the support from some institution.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pay for help to prepare the land to plant chili peppers, green beans, tomatoes and squash.

loans.name: Al-Salam Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-salam and consists of four ladies who live in Taiz, Yemen. Hamouda is living in a poor area in Taiz. She is a married woman and has children. 

She always suffers from cutting the electricity of her house. she accumulated a small amount to buy an electric generator to use for her house. so, she applied for a loan of 60,000 Yemen Rial (YER) from AMB to buy an electric generator to live comfortably with her family. she hopes to be funded by kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy an electric generator to live comfortably with her family.

loans.name: Sabir

texts.en:
Sabir is 37 years old client. He is married and has two kids. Sabir is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with his family in the Bilasuvar IDP settlement. He has been raising livestock for the past seven years. 

He usually buys calves, raises and fattens them, then sells them at a profitable price. Selling meat is a worthwhile business because meat is an essential staple among the local people, who use it in many everyday dishes like dolma and pilov.

Sabir is a very kind and friendly young man. His monthly income is 140 AZN, which represents the sole financial income for the family. He reports that it is very difficult to cover the needs of the family with such a small income. Looking after the animals is also difficult, requiring that he spends most of his time outside. 

The economic climate in the region is one of austerity, but Sabir is a very positive man and his father supports and helps him a great deal.

Sabir has applied for a loan in the amount of 1,500 Azerbaijan New Manat (AZN), with which he will buy two milk cows and three calves. This will be his third loan and he has a good client history.

loans.use: to buy two milk cows and three calves.

loans.name: Unión Hace La Fuerza  (Calceta) Group

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Unión Hace La Fuerza se reúne cada quince días en la hermosa ciudad de Calceta, ciudad conocida con el nombre de “Calceta la sin par”. Por la belleza de sus mujeres y porque para sus habitantes no hay ciudad más hermosa en el mundo.

Este es un grupo de 10 mujeres y 2 hombres que decidieron unirse y formar este Banco Comunal para recibir los créditos con los cuales esperan mejorar sus pequeños negocios con los cuales ellos salen adelante. Se dedican a diversas actividades tales como comercio, servicios, venta de comidas entre otras actividades.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la señora Flor, tiene 50 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos, dos mayores de edad y el menor de  10 años que estudia en la escuela. El marido es albañil.

Doña Flor se dedica a la venta de ropa, artículos de bazar y productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas), su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también tiene un pequeño local en su casa en el cual  vende sus productos, pero la mayor parte de sus ventas las realiza puerta a puerta. Trabaja todos los días, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada fin de semana. Lleva 5 años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual le ayuda a su marido a salir adelante ya que él en ocasiones no tiene trabajo, pero gracias a su negocio no les falta el pan en su mesa.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar ropa, cosméticos, artículos de bazar y bisuterías. Este es su primer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la rapidez con que salen los créditos. 

Su sueño es seguir adelante en el banco y su vida familiar.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Unión Hace La Fuerza” (Strength In Numbers) meets every 15 days in the beautiful city of Calceta, which also goes by the name of “Calceta La Sin Par”.  There is no other city in the world that is more beautiful because of the beauty of its women and its residents.  

This group of 10 women and 2 men decided to join together and form this Communal Bank so that they could receive loans in hopes of improving their small businesses, which allows them to get ahead.  They engage in different businesses that involve retail, services, selling food, and other activities.

One of the members of this group is Sra. Flor.   She is 50 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has three children.  Two of them are grown and the youngest is 10 years old and attends school.  Her husband is a bricklayer.  

Doña Flor sells clothing, bazaar items, and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and women’s accessories).  She sells by going door to door, but she also has a small shop in her house where she sells her products.  However, most of her sales are conducted by going door to door.  Flor works every day, extending credit to her customers and collecting payments every weekend.  She has been in this business for five years with the help of her husband.  They have been able to forge ahead even though he occasionally is without work.  Thanks to her business, she is able to put food on the table.  

Flor’s loan will be used to buy clothing, cosmetics, bazaar items, and trinkets.  This is her first loan cycle with the Communal Bank and she likes the fact that the loans are issued quickly.  Her dream is to move forward with her Communal Bank and in her family life.

loans.use: to buy clothing, cosmetics, bazaar items, and trinkets.

loans.name: Maximiliana

texts.es: Maximiliana es una mujer de 35 años, vive junto su esposo y sus dos hijos en su casa construida a base de adobe. Maximiliana se dedica a la producción de cacao orgánico y otros productos rentables de su localidad hace más de 15 años. Tiene la suerte de contar con unos terrenos muy productivas en cuanto a calidad de los productos. Poseen un terreno de 3 hectáreas en donde desempeña su labor diariamente. Tras realizar el reemplazo de varios árboles de cacao desfasados viene fertilizando sus terrenos únicamente con abono orgánico ya que es la única manera de desempeñar una agricultura responsable con el medio ambiente según comenta. Una de las necesidades que suele tener es la contrata de trabajadores del lugar para llevar a cabo sus distintas tareas como el retiro de maleza, aplicación de abono y corte de tallos defectuosos. Este es su segundo préstamo con Kiva  se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En está ocasion desea contar con 3,000 nuevo soles para la compra de un terreno de cultivo y expandir sus plantaciones de cacao para mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Maximiliana is a 35 year old woman.  She lives with her husband and their two children in their house.  Their house is constructed from adobe. 

She has worked for 15 years, producing organic cocoa and other profitable products.  She is lucky to have land that is very productive because of the products' quality. Their land is 3 hectares, and they work there daily. 

After replacing various outdated cocoa trees, they came to fertilize their land with compost.  According to comments, it was the only way to be responsible with agriculture and the environment.  Some of the needs that usually contract site workers to carry out, are removing weeds, applying manure, and cutting defective stems. 

This is her second loan with Kiva.  She feels very grateful for the financial help she received to move forward.  She agrees to pay her dues on time.  This time, she requests 3,000 new soles to purchase land for cultivation, and to expand their cocoa plantations to earn more income.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural land

loans.name: José Gregorio

texts.es: José tiene 22 años de edad, es soltero y padre de un hijo de 4 años. Nació y se crió en una familia humilde del campo, allí aprendió las labores agrícolas de la mano de sus padres, quienes se desempeñaron toda la vida como jornaleros y agricultores. Gracias a esos conocimientos y la tradición familiar, hoy en día cuenta con cultivos de maíz, los que cuida diariamente desde las 5:00 am, sobrepasando diversos obstáculos que en ocasiones afectan directamente su producción, como por ejemplo, las fuertes lluvias que inundan sus cultivos y dañan los sembrados, sin embargo, con su actitud ganadora, con su empeño y dedicación ha logrado salir adelante. Los ingresos que obtiene son el resultado de las ventas de los productos que recolecta y cosecha, lo que le ha permitido llevar el sustento diario a su hogar. Actualmente el cliente solicita el crédito, con el interés de invertirlo en la compra de insumos al por mayor (abonos, fertilizantes, insecticidas), con los que podrá mejorar la preparación de la tierra para la temporada de cosecha que se aproxima, en la cual espera sacar unos productos de excelente calidad que puedan ser vendidos a mejor precio en el mercado. José sueña con ampliar sus cultivos y sembrar otro tipo de productos para incrementar sus ingresos y darle a su familia una estabilidad económica favorable, con la que puedan mejorar el nivel de vida y darle una excelente educación a su pequeño hijo.
texts.en: José is 22 years old, single and has a 4-year-old son. He was born and raised in a humble home in the country. There, he learned how to farm by hand from his parents, who worked their whole lives as farmers and day laborers. Thanks to this knowledge and family tradition, today José has corn crops that he tends to daily from 5 a.m. onward. He has overcame a number of obstacles that at times impact his production, for example the heavy rains that flood his fields and damage the crops. However, with his winning attitude, hard work and dedication he has been able to make headway. The income he earns comes from selling the goods he harvests, which has allowed him to bring home the daily bread. He currently is requesting a loan, which he plans to use to purchase wholesale supplies (fertilizers and insecticides) so he can improve his production for the upcoming harvest. He hopes to have excellent products that he can sell for a higher price at the market. José's dream is to expand his crops and plant another kind of product to increase his income and give his family more economic stability and a higher quality of life, and so he can provide his young son with an excellent education.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale supplies (fertilizers, insecticides).

loans.name: Mabomba Mengi Group

texts.en:
Victoria, who is married with four children, is running a business selling different drinks such as beers, sodas, juices, and spirits for five years now. She is in her early 40s and doing great in her business. She works from 4 p.m. to midnight daily and is able to make a good profit per month. 

This will be Victoria's fifth loan request, which she will use to replenish her stock of beer, wine, water and juice to resell. She used her previous loans to buy a motorcycle, a freezer, and more business chairs.
 
With the business profit earned, she bought house utensils and a fridge, renovated her house, bought new iron sheets, and paid for home expenses. Victoria's dream is to buy a car of her own.

She will share this loan with her loan group, Mabomba Mengi, which consist of nine members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to replenish her stock of beer, wine, water, and juice to resell.

loans.name: Mehriniso

texts.ru: Мехринисо- женщина от которой исходит тепло и на неё хочется смотреть и восхищаться. Она эталон таджички-дехканки. Мехринисо одновременно занимается и земледелием и скотоводством. Она очень любит животных. Вот уже 10 лет как Мехринисо разводит крупнорогатый скот. У нее есть скотный двор. В ней сейчас живет только один бык - Бетто. Мехринисо хотела бы увеличить поголовье скота и просит ей помочь в развитии бизнеса. Она милая, добрая и заботливая женщина, живет с мужем и детьми в районе Пяндж. Ей далеко за 50 лет и в ведении деятельности ей помогает семья.
texts.en:
Mehriniso radiates warmth and people look at her with admiration. She is a typical Tadjik peasant. 

Mehriniso works in both farming and cattle breeding. She really loves animals. For over 10 years, Mehriniso has been breeding cattle. She has a barnyard. In it, she currently has only one bull, named Betto. Mehriniso would like to increase her herd and is asking for help in growing her business. 

She is a sweet, kind and caring woman. She lives with her husband and kids in the region of Pyandj. She is over 50 years old and her family helps out with her business.

loans.use: to buy cattle to increase her herd

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 42-year-old married father of three children who has worked in raising cows and selling fresh milk since a year ago.

Ahmad used to be a soldier, but he retired a year ago. His wife helps him in covering part of their expenses through working as a tailor from her house. Their low incomes combined together aren't enough for covering their children's needs; that's why he is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to  buy a new cow that will increase his business production.

Ahmad hopes to expand his business in the future and own a big, highly developed farm.

loans.use: To buy  a new cow that will increase his production.

loans.name: Sayit

texts.en:
Sayit is a Cameroonian aged 36 and living in an urban area. He is married with five children; the oldest child is 12 in secondary school, and the youngest is 3 in nursery school. He has been in this business for the past 18 years, which makes him very experienced and stable. He is likely to succeed because of his longevity and experience in the business, and also because the business is located near a mosque, where there are always many potential customers. 

This loan will help him increase his turnover from 900,000 XAF (Communaute Fananciere Africaine Francs Beac) to 1,150,000 XAF, and his profit will increase by 13 percent monthly. His standard of living will also increase as well.

loans.use: To buy communications credits.

loans.name: Good Deeds Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 37-year-old Noddie from Mutare. Noddie is a member of the Good Deeds Group. She is widowed with two children, both attending school. Noddie runs a clothing business selling kidswear, handbags and cosmetics. The business has been in operation for nine years. She says the main challenge faced is high import costs at the border posts. 

Noddie has requested a loan of $400 to purchase clothing to sell during the summer season. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve her family's welfare. In the future, Noddie plans to have her own boutique shop.

loans.use: To buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Rza

texts.en:
Rza is a 45-year-old. Rza is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with his family in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. After several attempts to find a job, he decided to start his own business. He is a farmer and has raised seasonal fruits and vegetables for the last 10 years. He breeds cattle, too.

He chose this business because it is profitable and fresh crops are in high demand. People use fresh vegetables every day and consider them healthy. Many national dishes are made from vegetables, like pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits are served on every Azerbaijan family’s table and are also used to make fresh punch.

Rza sells his crops in the Bilasuvar central bazaar. His monthly income is 100 AZN (Azerbaijani new manat). His wife actively helps him to raise the crops.

As his products are in high demand, Rza wants to expand his business and produce more fruits and vegetables to cover market demand. For this purpose, he applied for 2,000 AZN. He will buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers. This will be his sixth loan, and he has a positive loan history.

loans.use: to buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Evershining Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 43-year-old Sekai from Mutare. Sekai is a member of the Evershining Group. She is single with two children, one attending school. She also cares for one dependent. Sekai runs a retail business selling dried fish. The business has been in operation for six years. She says the main challenge faced is debtors failing to repay on time. 

Sekai has requested a loan of $400 to buy dried fish from Mozambique for resale in Mutare. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve her family's welfare. In the future, Sekai plans to supply fish to large supermarkets and own a truck for transportation.

loans.use: To purchse dried fish from Mozambique for resale.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en: Mary Jane is a 25-year-old banana dealer in the village of Mabbayad, Echague. She is married to Erick, a rice farmer and they are blessed with two children. Mary Jane and her husband have been planting bananas for almost two years. Their banana vending business also assisted them in providing for  their farming needs. They want to sustain their banana planting and vending so they can have a source of income while waiting for the harvest season for their rice. Mary Jane would like to borrow PHP 7,000 to purchase fertilizers to sustain their banana planting. She believes that this loan will be a great help in her enterprise and also for her to have a sustainable business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer to sustain their banana planting

loans.name: Gulustan

texts.en:
Gulustan is 47 years old. She is married and the mother of  five beautiful children.  She is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with her husband and children in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. Gulustan and her husband are engaged in their own business in order to have the income to meet their family's needs. She has been engaged in cattle breeding for the past 13 years. During these years, she gained the necessary skills and knowledge for the effective management of her business.
